campaign.story:
Get Your Project Funded Today!
   Traditional belts are only comfortable some of the time and don't compliment long demanding days that quickly transition between work, play, and downtime. Not to mention your waistline fluctuates during the day... shouldn't your belt, too?
The Kemer Belt brings together premium materials, strong design elements, and versatility to provide all-day comfort, unique styling, and simple transitions from the office, to the outdoors, to the couch.
We want to keep this very simple... we love these belts, and we think you will, too. We started wearing our first belt samples over 12 months ago, and we have been wearing them ever since.
Kemer Belts are simple, versatile, comfortable, stylish, reversible, travel-friendly, water-friendly, and adult and kid approved. Choose from among 6 adult/youth belt designs and 2 kids belt designs as shown below:
                We are working with one of the top manufacturers of elastic jacquard to ensure the highest quality materials and the best weave. We have tested the materials with all kinds of clothing, in multiple weather conditions, and in various work, play, and chill environments – and they are ready for prime time.

Some of our favorite features of the belt include:
We doubled the wardrobe options by making each belt reversible. In most cases, the reverse design is a solid color for ultimate flexibility. However, our crowning jewel is the Brooklyn belt crafted in “Herringtooth” design - you get Herringbone on one side and Houndstooth on the other.
The belts transition perfectly from work to play. Choose a conservative design for work attire, and then flip, untuck, and head out for some after-work sport or fun.
The belts really do make every pair of pants feel like your favorite pair of sweatpants. The elastic jacquard expands and contracts with your waist throughout the day and flexes with you no matter which way you bend, stretch, stoop, jump, or flip.
Our belts have traveled thousands of miles and have racked up a lot of frequent flyer miles. You may have to take off your shoes for airport security, but these belts stay on and breeze right through metal detectors and security scanners.
The belts are the perfect companion for advanced quick-dry shorts and other beachwear. And, don’t worry if you accidentally leave your belt in your favorite pair of jeans when you throw them in the wash.
The simple high-strength polymer buckle makes it easy for kids to open and close the belt for easy access (in case of emergencies!). Kids love the fun designs, too.
Kemer Belts are completely adjustable, but come in two general sizes – Adult/Youth size and Kids size. In both cases, the belts are one-size-fits-most where the Adult/Youth belts fit up to a 38-40 inch waist, while the Kids belts fit . . . . well, they fit kids!
             We have enjoyed watching the design community simplify the accessories we use everyday, and we want to participate. We love simplicity, we love design, and we love to create. We had the idea for the Kemer Belt during one of our brainstorming sessions on the potential uses of elastic webbing. Our thoughts quickly took us to one of the accessories we use every day – the belt. We sourced jacquard elastic from a local supplier and simulated the reversibility by sewing two different designs together back-to-back.
Within a couple of days – and with the help of a great seamstress (thanks Aimee) – we had a working sample. From there, we kicked into design and material sourcing mode. It has taken much longer than we thought to find the right factory, but we are pleased to have ended up with premier manufacturing and product development partners.
We have come a long way since our first working sample, and we are excited about the finished product. Everyone who has worn an Kemer Belt loves it – and we know you will, too.
campaign.risks:

updates.update_userinfo: Additional Shipping Progress Update
updates.update_content:
Hello Backers,
We wanted to let you know that all, but a very small percentage, of rewards (including international rewards) left the fulfillment center on Tuesday and Wednesday, and they are on their way to you. Our fulfillment partners tells us that the tracking numbers do not become active until 24-48 hours after leaving the warehouse. We are waiting for the tracking numbers to become active before we send you an email with your individual tracking codes. Our shipping partner told us to expect shipping times of 7-14 days for international orders, depending on the remoteness of your location. We really are in the final stages now, and we appreciate your support.

updates.update_userinfo: Shipping Continues & Video Tips
updates.update_content:
Hello Backers,
We are excited that you have started receiving the belts, and we appreciate the early feedback. We had actually intended to send out a few instructional videos prior to you receiving the belts, but with the craziness of shipping, we were not able to do it. You will find a few videos here in this update. They are not very professional, but we hope they highlight some of the tips and tricks related to using the belts.

updates.update_userinfo: Shipping is a Go!!!
updates.update_content:
Hello Backers,
As of Thursday (yesterday), product is now in the capable hands of our shipping partner, and all of the mailing list processing and preparation is complete.
An update from them at the end of business today stated that rewards will be packaged and sent out through Monday to Tuesday due to the high volume of the orders. Of course everyone will be on various shipping and delivery timelines due to the broad mix of our backers' locations around the world. Our goal is to provide the most information we can for your reward package and estimated delivery, but we are limited in some cases depending on your corner of the globe.

updates.update_userinfo: Belts Have Landed
updates.update_content:
Hello Backers,

The belts have arrived! We are really excited to have all of the belts in our zip code, so we can take this project to the finish line. We are packing the belts into individual plastic bags right now, and we will deliver them to our fulfillment partner as soon as we are done. Our fulfillment partner is local, so it is just an easy truck drive away. We will update early next week with photos of the fulfillment process as shipments go out.

campaign.story:
Missed out on the Kickstarter campaign?
Visit www.fantasyartworkshop.com to learn how you can purchase Jeff Miracola’s Fantasy Art Workshop Acrylic Painting Technique DVD, digital download, T-shirts, and more.
This Kickstarter campaign funds the creation of a Jeff Miracola Fantasy Art Workshop Acrylic Painting Technique Video to be released both as a region-free DVD and as a digital download.
If you are one of my more than 22,000 YouTube subscribers, you've seen the many helpful art instruction videos that I've posted to my channel over the years. With close to 1 million views on my channel, I am humbled at the world-wide reach and interest in my videos. My wife, who does the camera work for most of my videos, and I have been touched by all the praise for our production quality and useful information I share in my videos. I love creating these videos because it feels good to pass on the knowledge of the traditional painting techniques that I've honed over the years. If you haven't seen my YouTube channel, you should go visit it to see what all the fuss is about :-)
But as much as I share about painting processes in my YouTube videos, there is only so much I can squeeze into a 15- or 30-minute video, so I have decided to create the most comprehensive acrylic painting technique video I can possibly imagine.
This is where I need your help. Because my wife and I create our videos all by ourselves, it takes a lot of planning, filming, and editing to make even the simplest of videos for my YouTube channel. But now I want to create a four-hour long video. It's a monster of a project that we look forward to tackling. By pledging to my project, you are not only helping me to cover the cost of manufacturing the DVDs, you're giving me the most important thing I need: Time. To create this full length video, I will have to free up at least three months of time to make it happen. That means I won't be able to take on my usual freelance work, which is how I make my income.
So please look over the details of this project below. I hope you will consider pledging. I thank you so very much for any support you can give.
VERY IMPORTANT: I have not yet created the artwork that will be featured in this technique video. The imagery you see on this page (grey and green monster with blue tongue) is only used to give you an example of what the packaging will look like. This is not the final image. I hope to share sketches of the final art during the course of this Kickstarter campaign.

The content of this video will benefit beginners to professionals at any stage of their careers. My goal is to not only give you the most detailed look at my acrylic painting process but also to answer your many questions about creating an acrylic painting from start to finish. I will focus heavily on creating a professional fantasy painting for a paying client. This video won't just cover the "how;" it will also cover the "why."

Here are some of the topics and techniques that will be demonstrated in this video:
Brainstorming/Conceptualization 
Anatomy (Creature and Human) 
Using Reference Photos
Drawing from the Imagination
Tools for Sketching (Types, Care, and Use)
Thumbnail Sketching
Composition
Final Sketch
Color Roughs
Color Theory and Composition
Painting Surfaces (Preparation, Materials, and Tools)
Transferring the Final Drawing to its Painting Surface
Planning the Stages of Painting
Palettes (Types, Care, and Use)
Paints (Types, Care, and Use)
Brushes (Types, Care, and Use)
Solvents (Types, Care, and Use)
Mediums (Types, Care, and Use)
Underpainting (Process and Purpose)
Glazing and Scumbling
Building Form through Layering
Opaque versus Transparent Color
Mixing and Blending Colors
Painting Problematic Subjects (Glass, Metal, Skin Tones)
Painting Effects (Splatters, Textures, etc.)
Airbrush (Care and Use)
Work Area (Easel, Drawing Table, Dining Room Table)
Sealing The Final Painting (Materials and Use)
General Safety (Tools and Materials)
As you can see, this video will be packed with information. Throughout the course of this Kickstarter campaign, I may be adding more topics to this list.
I encourage you to use the comments section of this campaign to let me know of other topics you might like discussed and/or demonstrated in this video.
The bonus DVD is only available to backers that pledge to receive a physical DVD reward. The bonus DVD content is not available to backers that only choose the DIGITAL DOWNLOAD reward.

Here's a list of some of the content that will be on the Bonus DVD:
Q&A Session with Jeff (I will answer many common and not-so common questions about acrylic painting techniques and more.);
Technique Demonstrations (I will show various techniques that are not featured on the main DVD content.);
Studio Walkthrough (I will give you a tour of my painting studio.);
Building a Portfolio (I will give you advice on how to build your art portfolio.);
Freelance Career Advice (I will talk about some of the pros and cons of freelancing and how to avoid pitfalls.); and
Outtakes and Bloopers (You all know I can never say my lines correctly the first time, but it's always fun seeing me try.)
I may add more content to the Bonus DVD based on backer feedback in the comments section of this page during the course of the campaign.
The $12,000 stretch goal has been reached! This means that every backer that pledged for a physical reward (THE DVD level and up) will receive my "Something Wicked - Creature Portfolio" for FREE!All prints in the portfolio will be signed and feature all new, never before seen art.

All Digital Download Only backers will receive a PDF download of this portfolio for FREE!
The $17,000 stretch goal has been reached! This means that every backer that has pledged at the $35 reward level and up will receive my "Art Instruction Video Collection" DVD for FREE! The DVD will contain a selection of my YouTube videos in hi-resolution for offline viewing. The DVD will also contain two never-before-seen videos!

The success of any crowd funding campaign relies on people sharing it with their friends. Please consider sharing my Kickstarter campaign with others using the links below. Thank you!
T-Shirt Size Chart

The shirts are in-line with standard North American sizing. Use the chart below to find your specific size, if you're unsure. Note: The shirts have a structured fit, I recommend ordering a size up if you would like a little wiggle room.

Women's Size Chart
Men's Size Chart
Very Important T-Shirt Ordering Information:

$20 Digital Download Only level backers:
Backers living in the United States:
Add $45 ($40 + $5 shipping) to your pledge for each T-shirt you would like to order. If you want one t-shirt, your new pledge total should be $65
Backers living outside the United States:
Add $55 ($40 + $15 shipping) to your pledge for each T-shirt you would like to order. If you want one t-shirt, your new pledge total should be $75

$35 level backers and up:
Shipping anywhere in the world:
Add $40 to your pledge for each T-shirt you would like to order.
Add-on instructions: To add an add-on to your pledge, follow these steps:
1. Press the ‘Manage Your Pledge’ button above (top of page). If you have not pledged yet, it will say ‘Back this Project’.
2. Increase your pledge in the ‘Pledge Amount’ box by the total of the add-ons you want to add.
3. After the end of this Kickstarter campaign you will receive a survey that will ask you questions so that you can explain how you would like the add-on money assigned. Example: I'll ask you which T-shirt/s you want to order,  which size/s you would like, and if you want a women's or men's T-shirt.
I have been creating fantasy art professionally for more than 22 years. I've illustrated for properties such as Dungeons & Dragons, World of Warcraft, Mars Attacks, Star Wars, Planescape, Earthdawn, Shadowrun, and Magic: the Gathering, for which I've created 110 paintings.
I've also done conceptual toy and video game design, editorial illustrations, and picture books, as well as various activity books for Klutz/Scholastic.

For a few years now I have been sharing my acrylic and oil painting, inking, and drawing techniques through my YouTube channel, which has grown to over 22,000 subscribers and nearly 1 million views.
Visit my website at www.jeffmiracola.com

A few examples of my shorter, free videos on my YouTube channel:
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
My wife and I already successfully delivered one Kickstarter project earlier this year. We are very proud that we estimated our production schedule properly and all backers of that project received their rewards on time or earlier than expected.

With that being said, there are sometimes production delays. But I'm happy to say that I am working with a manufacturer right here in my home state of Wisconsin to produce the DVDs. This will certainly help eliminate any communication or shipping issues.

My goal is to make sure all backers have their digital download or physical rewards in hand sometime in December 2015, preferably before Christmas.

I will keep you updated at every step of the process. If anything changes, such as my preferred timeline or production schedule, you will be the first to know.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Hi, Everyone.
My wife and I have created a new, in-person workshop called Fantasy Art Workshop's Illustration Intensive. It's a five-day workshop taking place June 18-22, 2018 at Alverno College in Milwaukee, Wisconsin.
We are thrilled to have two incredible Guests of Honor so far, award-winning illustrator Scott Gustafson and publisher/art director Jon Schindehette. Faculty includes myself, and fellow artists Aaron Miller, and Steve Prescott.

updates.update_userinfo: Our Card Tokens featuring Groblins Kickstarter is LIVE!
updates.update_content:
Hi, Everyone.
I'm happy to announce we just launched another Kickstarter project. I know you're a fan of our art tutorial videos since you graciously backed this Acrylic DVD project and may have even backed our Oil DVD project, but our new project is not an art tutorial video. The new project is called "Card Tokens featuring Groblins" and is for the creation of a pack of card tokens that card game players use in games such as Magic: the Gathering. The art showcases the more humorous side of my art and personality. If you play MTG or have friends that play, they might be interested in this Kickstarter campaign. Please give it a look to see what it's all about.

campaign.story:
MISSED OUT ON OUR KICKSTARTER?
Last chance to snag pre-order pricing at getbetterback.com
Check your posture right now. 
How is your back? And your neck? Probably not too great. Or you’re already in so much pain that someone sent you here (hugs). BetterBack allows you to effortlessly sit in perfect posture, easing back pain.
Highlights
BetterBack makes every chair ergonomic – Instead of spending hundreds of dollars on one chair, you can make every chair ergonomic. Lightweight and portable, you can throw BetterBack in your purse or backpack.
Next gen back support –  The keystone to good posture is the pelvis. Traditional back supports only focus on your lumbar spine. BetterBack stabilizes your pelvis, restoring your spine's natural curvature, and provides lumbar support. 
15 minutes a day – Like dumbbells at a gym, BetterBack helps you build up your posture muscles. Wear it for as little as 15 minutes a day to achieve great posture when you stand or sit on your own.
                                      BetterBack allows you to effortlessly sit in perfect posture, easing back pain. Even if you don’t have back pain, wearing it for just 15 minutes a day can retrain your default posture, so when you stand or sit without BetterBack, your posture is greatly improved. Good posture boosts your mood, confidence, motivation and overall health. 
Take a few seconds to re-posture yourself right now. If you’re sitting, chances are your back isn’t touching your chair at all. That’s because most chairs aren’t ergonomic, and many actually encourage bad posture. BetterBack makes every chair ergonomic. Sit effortlessly in perfect posture at your desk. Or on a plane. Or at a game. You get the idea.
You get fast results and long term comfort. Put BetterBack on in 5 seconds flat!
                                    Sit in perfect posture for minutes or hours. We took sizing into account from the 1 percentile woman all the way up to the 99 percentile man, so BetterBack can be adjusted to fit just about every body.
Imagine going to 50 of the best doctors, therapists and trainers around the world and asking them for their #1 posture tip. Well we did, and we put them together into an eBook for you.
Or get the Better Posture eBook FOR FREE!
If you’re not in a place to financially contribute to our campaign, we still care about your posture and your health! Simply share our Kickstarter page with your friends on Facebook or Twitter and we’ll give you the full copy of Better Posture for free. Just click on one of the share buttons below then enter your email where you’d like to receive the book here: http://bit.ly/1DHsTSq
                                                                                            You'll get every version of BetterBack ever made! Be the first to try them during prototyping and the first to own them after production. Plus, grab a flight to San Francisco and we'll get you set up with a custom training program, including three personalized workouts with Vint. We'll also roll out the red carpet for you and a friend to enjoy a chef-prepared dinner at my apartment with the amazing people who helped bring this project to life. Ask us anything!
Shipping
When you back this project, you’ll see shipping prices for your home country. We are based in the United States, but will be fulfilling orders from the US, Canada, EU and Hong Kong. Please note that if you live outside of those regions, you may be responsible for local duties, fees and taxes.
A few years ago, in the lovely year of 2012, I was the co-founder of a startup, Everest, that was building technology to help people live their dreams and achieve personal goals. I was mostly in front of a computer 12+ hours a day, but we also put on the Dream Series, which were meaningful events to help kickstart people's dreams. A few hours after an amazing obstacle course run through Golden Gate Park, my sciatica pain began. The pain and discomfort made it hard to concentrate, do great work and enjoy life.
Post-race wearing the trophy (the Golden Shoes) a few hours before sciatica pain would forever change my life. #NotWorthIt
I tried dozens of products, therapies and techniques to help with my back pain. Many of them had great features, but weren't full solutions for me. The Neo G Posture Brace: helped with alignment, but it was difficult to breathe and really bulky under my clothes; Easy Posture Lumbar Support: I still managed to wiggle and slump in my chair, and it only helped when I sat at my desk; the Nada Chair: brilliant knee form and pelvic stabilization, but gave me knee pain after just a few minutes of wear; LF Ultrasound: provided short-term pain relief, but it was fleeting; Memory Foam Knee Pillow: provided better alignment when I started sleep, but would end up in the bottom of my bed; and on and on.
A friend and I spent weeks tinkering with anything we could find to help get back support. There are still taped together take-out soup containers for lumbar support floating around my apartment. The first version of the BetterBack knees? A cut out from the top of a mega-sized protein bottle. 
Making the latest knee prototypes. So many iterations in between!
I had no idea how many people were suffering from back pain when this all began. I felt way too young to have back pain, personally. Friends or colleagues would see me wearing the early versions of BetterBack and ask to try it. As soon as they did, I would get messages all the time: "Oh hey, I'm flying to New York on Tuesday, any chance I can borrow that thing you wear?" Or "My back is acting up, any chance I can just borrow it until Friday?" I had no idea so many people were suffering. I began to do more research and was blown away by what I found.  I decided to make more -- and invest time and money into making it better. 
Six prototypes later, I began working with manufacturers to build a high quality, well crafted and incredibly comfortable posture strap I would be proud to see my mom wear. And your mom too, if she doesn't have an awesome back.
I'm on Kickstarter for two reasons. One, I'm hoping 500 people will pledge so I can hit the minimum order quantity and produce the very first run of BetterBacks. Even more importantly, I'm hoping to find people who will go on the journey with me to get a better back. I want to hear your story, what has worked and hasn't worked for you in the past, understand how BetterBack helps you and how it can help you better.  Please join me.
Good posture affects your health, your mood and your motivation. Most people only begin to understand the importance of posture after their body is so damaged from slumping that sitting aches become chronic pain. I know because I am one of them.
My mission is to help people be their best selves and unlock their full potential. Without health, that is impossible; it is the foundation for everything else.
I have spent the last few years learning about back pain, trying a huge range of products and therapies, and developing BetterBack with dozens on dozens of bad backs and amazing souls.
The relief and support people feel while wearing BetterBack—and even after—is truly amazing. No matter how many times or tools you’ve tried to sit pain free, BetterBack is like posture training wheels so you can experience and integrate good posture into your life for good.
I have self funded the design, development and sampling for BetterBack. Our final prototype has been well tested and our manufacturers are ready to go. Every dollar pledged will go towards manufacturing, quality assurance, packaging and shipping. 
BetterBack was my first Kickstarter campaign. It has been some of the most amazing and challenging few weeks of my life. If you are thinking of running a crowdfunding campaign, I encourage you to take the leap and go for it. You will connect with the most incredible global community of supporters and get to bring a part of yourself to life. I wanted to share some of the amazingly talented people who contributed to my campaign; maybe one day they will help you with your campaign too.
Industrial Design // I had the chance to work with three amazing industrial designers on the development of BetterBack.
Andy Storms is a softgoods and SolidWorks pro. Smart, thoughtful and a joy to work with. Reach him at andy@neverago.com
Josh Guyot is the go-to guy for innovative product design and custom parts. Shoot him a note at josh@guyotdesigns.com
Liam Woods specializes in the interaction of soft goods, hardware, and the human body. Check him out at liamwoodsdesign.com
Video // Theo Souza at Onsight Media helped me develop my script and shoot/ edit my video. He is incredibly talented and an absolute delight to work with. You can reach him here:  theo@onsight.media
Graphic Design // Peter Green is the wonder who created the graphics on this page, even when I needed something without warning in 20 minutes. :) Check him out at Free Money Studio 
Product Development + Branding // Victor Mathieux was my co-tinkerer in the earliest days of BetterBack, hit the streets with me to test BetterBack on dozens of strangers and was a huge part of its evolution. His branding skills are out of this world. www.victormathieux.com
Photography // Julian Bialowas shot all of the photography on this page in 45 minutes. He is that good. He is also a super talented designer. Check him out at instagram.com/julianbialowas
Marketing // I had an extensive marketing plan developed before I launched my Kickstarter campaign and will be writing about what worked and what didn't on my website katherinekrug.com. The soma creators have a great post and Stonemaier Games has a series of helpful posts on KS marketing.
I wasn't expecting so many marketing companies to reach out after I launched my campaign (be ready for it!) and I decided to try out a handful of them. By far these were the best:
Funded Today - These guys brought a wealth of experience and expertise to my campaign. I just wish I had known about them earlier.  I'm certain I would not have reached $1M without their help. Find them at http://bit.ly/1EMP9eC
BackerClub - These guys have a strong community of engaged Kickstarter backers and a fun rewards club. BackerClub.co 
Special thanks to Dr. Ryan Lawlor for his tremendous help (www.drlawlor.com), Ramon and Renato for helping me test new marketing channels (GrowthHack.com.br), Josh Krigman as a hugely talented writer (joshkrigman.com), Collin Hughes for photography in my video (http://collin-hughes.com/), and Jonathan Swanson, Pam Krug and Peter Dering for their endless support. 
Bear hug to every single one of the backers who supported bringing BetterBack to life! 
Visit us at www.getbetterback.com
How much should I wear it?
Sit in perfect posture for minutes or hours. It is comfortable to wear all day long, but even 15 minutes a day can greatly improve the quality of your life.
Will I look stupid wearing it?
It's hard to believe, but most people don't even notice when you're wearing it. I sit through meals, meetings and flights with BetterBack on and it's only when I'm taking it off that people tend to notice it, with a "you've been wearing that this whole time?!!" The thing that tends to happen next is someone shares their story of back pain and asks to try it on. 
How comfortable are the knee straps?
I have absolutely terrible knees (at one point I was put in two leg casts because of feet and knee injuries, later having surgery on my right knee). We spent a lot of time designing the knee cushions so that the force was widely distributed and comfortable for people who have knee problems *and* back problems.
Can I wear BetterBack while I drive?
Unfortunately, no. BetterBack is not safe to wear driving, or when you need quick leg mobility. It is great for sitting at your desk, eating, meeting, going to a movie, sitting on an airplane, meditating, etc. Note: you can wear BetterBack cross-legged! 
How is this different than the Nada Chair?
Let me start by pouring heaps of praise and adoration on Dr. Toso who came up the knee form to help people with their posture. I have tried the Nada Chair and while I loved the stabilization it offered, it unfortunately hurt my knees very badly to wear after just a few minutes. It wasn’t a solution for me as a result.
BetterBack uses the same knee form as the Nada Chair, but the design and construction of the knee pads, back support and straps are new, incorporating six rounds of prototyping with two amazing Industrial Designers and the feedback of 62 wonderful backs who beta tested it last year and this year. Here are some of the ways BetterBack is different:
Knees, knees, knees!
We use PE (polyethylene) to disperse force and foam to provide cushiony comfort on the knees, so even people with bad knees can wear BetterBack. Because of backer support, everyone’s knee pads will now include thicker compression molded foam for even more durability and comfort. :)
Back pad
BetterBack is worn outside of clothing, but it can still get hot on an airplane, at a game or when things heat up at work. BetterBack combines a perforated foam and spacer mesh for maximum back breathability, without sacrificing lumbar support.
Straps & Adjustability
Strap adjusters are placed where your hands naturally rest, for easy tightening and loosening. Quick slip keepers keep the straps flush against BetterBack for a clean and minimalist look.
Usability
We’ve developed two ways to make sure people can put BetterBack on quickly and correctly. The first is using a poly cotton fabric for the outside materials and a spacer mesh for the inside materials that touch your body. On inside surfaces, we’ve also included easy to read icons so you know exactly which way is up without any guessing.
Materials
We want people to feel good and confident wearing BetterBack, so we’ve sourced high quality, durable materials similar to what you’d find in fashion, rather than in the medical section.
This all started in my kitchen, trying to make something to help me with my excruciating sciatica pain. My friends and people I’d meet all around San Francisco turned out to need it too. Never in my wildest dreams did I think it would be such a success on Kickstarter! I believe Dr. Toso was a visionary and I hope to see much more attention and innovation on the knee form/pelvis stabilization in the years to come, just as innovation on lumbar support products mean people looking can find something just right for them.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I have extensive manufacturing and operational experience (I used to manufacture interiors to large condominium buildings and hotels), plus two manufacturers capable of delivering BetterBack. One thing I know for sure: something unexpected always comes up. I’ve buffered my timeline to account for unexpected curveballs that may impact the schedule, so I can deliver BetterBack to you on time. These things could also impact the delivery schedule:

Volume - sometimes Kickstarter campaigns wildly exceed a project creator’s expectation. If we hit huge volume, it may push the timeline back, likely to the tune of 14 days. 

Really awesome ideas - I know I will receive some amazing ideas and insights from the Kickstarter community. I don't want to lose out on the ability to deliver you a superior product, if it can be reasonably done.

Freight - Port closures and customs delays happen. It’s impossible to know when and for how long. The buffer calculated into the timeline should cover this, but it is an unknown.

My goal is to deliver the highest quality, most effective posture strap on the market. I will work my back off for you and deliver transparency all the way through. Feel free to reach out to me personally anytime you have a thought, idea or a question at kk@getbetterback.com.

Last but not least: any pledge amount brings us closer to our goal -- both of hitting our first production run and of building awareness around good posture. Please click the ‘Back This Project’ button at the top of the page, or help us spread the word by sharing this page with the people you love. Big thanks and a pat on the.... !
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello BetterBack Backers!
I hope each and every one of you has been amazing! I wanted to share a manufacturing update. We have been working so hard and are pleased to share that everything is running on schedule. Woohoo! I’ve found a packaging company I love and will be working with my designer this week to make something special for you guys.

campaign.story:
With the humbling and overwhelming success of the first book, I've decided to expand the concept, making this a series of beautifully illustrated, high end art books, concentrating on different aspects of the world of Creature and Character Design. They will cover everything from prosthetic makeup, puppets, and stop motion as well as some of the cutting edge work being done with CGI these days. I feel this is yet another way to explore and share my passion for creatures, monsters, makeup, film and toys, by bringing you the best quality books possible, at an affordable price.
Author Sandy Collora sculpts a maquette for his film; "Shallow Water".
This second installment, appropriately titled The Art of Creature and Character Design Volume 2, will focus mostly on maquettes, models and miniatures. This volume will be a little bit more of a "how to" book, showing the techniques of making armatures, sculpting in different mediums and painting for the film industry, toys, models and miniature gaming pieces.
Collaborations by the author with Jose Fernandez and Jordu Schell.
It will feature some awesome collaborations done over the years by myself, Jordu Schell and a few other artists returning from the first book, as well as showcasing the art of some of the most revered and widely respected names in the collectible sculpture and model kit industry. The Shiflett Brothers; Brandon and Jarod, Tony Cipriano, Tim Bruckner, Shawn Nagle and Mike Hill are just a few of the amazing artists that will be featured in this stunning volume.
The Shifletts, Shawn Nagle and Brandt Peters.
One of the greatest things that happened over the course of compiling the first book, was getting introduced to some astounding artists that I'd never heard of before, who will be included in Volume 2. These European artisans simply made my jaw drop, with some astonishing miniature and model kit sculpture work. Patrick Masson, Giorgos Tsougkouzidis, Jason Monkman and Apikit Mechan, will be joining Brandt Peters, Damon Bard, Chris Gabrish, Mark Newman and others, to round out the roster of simply brilliant artists in The Art of Creature and Character Design Volume 2.
The brilliant miniature work of Patrick Masson.
Damon Bard, Giorgos Tsougkouzidis, and Apikit Mechan
And if you missed the opportunity to grab the first book, don't worry... There's two reward tiers that feature BOTH copies! The first book is almost sold out, so there will be a limited number of rewards in these tiers.
Stay tuned for more news, imagery and stretch goals in this exciting new chapter in The Art of Creature and Character Design. Thanks again for all your love and support on book one. It was truly a collaborative effort, that I couldn't have done without all my colleagues and most importantly, all of YOU.
Here is the T shirt that has been added to ALL the reward tiers. Basically, I've created a new reward tier for each one available and added 13 dollars for the shirt. If you've already pledged, and would like the shirt, just look for the same tier you backed, with the 13 dollars added on and adjust your pledge! It's that simple. The other REALLY cool and exciting thing about this, is that it's opened up a new reward tier for the early bird, giving you another chance to get the softcover for 30 dollars AND the T shirt. This is reward tier #7 and it gives people 50 more chances to get the early bird price on the book if you want the Tee! Shirts will available from Small to 5X. (2x and above sizes will require a few more dollars that will be invoiced when I send out the surveys.)
C'mon, who doesn't love to make monsters?
Thanks again from the bottom of my heart,
SC

Here are some reviews from the first book;
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
A book is always a difficult undertaking. Good printing to do a book of this quality is not cheap, and it's a lot of work. I've had to wrangle the help of a lot of different artists, to contribute to the book. Shipping to foreign countries also presents challenges, but it simply comes down to whether backers outside the US are willing to pay extra for the shipping of the actual book. It makes it more expensive, and that's why I'm offering a digital download as well, for my foreign backers. Printing also has a tendency to run a bit behind schedule, especially to a perfectionist like me. In the event that situation arises, I will keep everyone appraised of the situation with constant updates, just like I did on my last very successful KICKSTARTER campaign for The Art of Creature and Character Design Volume 1, where I kept everyone updated along the way and had a great time doing it. I'm hoping this campaign will be equally successful, and bring this awesome book to everyone who pledges.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
To anyone who has not yet gotten their books, all I can really say, is that for some reason, this time around, there were A LOT of problems with the foreign packages. I did not have this problem on the last campaign at ALL.
Many of them, for some reason, got returned to me for insufficient postage and were held up in customs as well, due to the MAGNET of all things. I don't understand this, and have spent many hours at my local post office, complaining and trying to find out what's going on and why. I also found out that several boxes of my parcels that were designated for foreign delivery, SAT AT THE POST OFFICE for weeks at a time, again for no explainable reason, according to them.

updates.update_content:
To all my overseas backers,
The last half dozen batches of books that I tried to send out (all foreign) were flagged by local post office for what eventually turned out to be the magnet. I have no idea why, but I was told that the packages going overseas in the envelopes I'm shipping them in, needed to be perfectly flat from now on to ship. This seemed odd to me, so I researched it a bit more and found something to the effect of what I was told. I'm not sure if it's a temporary thing, because I have already shipped several foreign books with the magnet, apparently without issue.

updates.update_userinfo: To all my incredibly awesome backers of this book...
updates.update_content:
Actually, it is spelled "Indy" when it's short for Indianapolis. That's where I am off to, for MaskFest - a pretty cool show. If any of you hail from them parts, please look me up and stop by. I'll be accompanied by Volume 2 of The Art of Character and Creature Design, of course.
Then there is the other "Indie" as in short for independent, as in indie film. MaskFest has asked me to speak about "Shallow Water", my new indie film on Kickstarter. They were very interested in the creature I was creating for that film. There's a growing consternation about Hollywood's reluctance to create new creature icons itself (in favor of "safer" reboots, sequels, and yet more super heroes). So heck, if Hollywood won't do it, I will!

campaign.story:
The Long-Awaited Sister Book is Here!
My first Kickstarter, the Complete Elmore full-color art book, was a huge success! I am very happy with how that book turned out, and have heard from many very happy backers about its quality. Now, I want to make available, through this project, the sister book to that one.
I have found more than 600 drawings I’d like to include in this book, from rough sketches to finished drawings. Some are pencil, some are ink, and some are a combination. These span my full 40 year career, from my TSR days through last week! Some are sketches and drawings used as the basis for some of my more famous paintings, but many you've probably never seen before.
This book, being the sister book to that first one, will be the same 9" x 12" size and encompass 256 pages. Depending on your pledge amount, you can own this book as a standard coffee-table hardback edition, or a deluxe leather-bound limited edition; as well as other bonuses, such as special prints, a Complete Elmore slipcase for both books, or even the original drawing used for the cover itself.
I want to make it clear that this book is being published by me, Larry Elmore, and is being assembled, packaged and shipped by only three people: my wife, Betty, my friend, Gary Triplett, and myself. Betty is an unbelievably hard worker when it comes to packaging and shipping these books. She’s a morning person, so she’s constantly pushing us to get an earlier start on each day and get done before midnight! Gary has been a special help with the editing and order fulfillment on my first Kickstarter project, the full-color Complete Elmore. He also helped me on my SnarfQuest New Adventure Kickstarter: The Plains of Sashaar, with editing, coloring, layout and order fulfillment. He is continuing to help me in all aspects of this project as well. Gary not only has a Master’s degree in IT, he also taught English as a professor at a Korean University for ten years and is currently writing his own series of fantasy books… all of which makes him a great editor.
The leatherback edition of this book is limited to 500 and is only going to be available through this Kickstarter. The standard hardcover edition of the book is being made available at a special Kickstarter price, but after the Kickstarter will be made available through my website (larryelmore.com) and conventions for the retail price of $75.
I want to say one more thing, and this is very important to me. YOU are helping me realize my dream of bringing this collection of almost all my artwork, throughout my career, to you, my fans. You guys have been instrumental in my long successful career as an illustrator. Without your appreciation and support I probably couldn’t hold a job as a Wal-Mart greeter… ‘cause I’d be drawing all the time! J
Thank you in advance for your pledge!
Cover Drawing "Rough"
 This is the "rough" (sketch) drawing of the front cover for this book. The final, finished drawing will appear on both the standard and leatherback versions of the book. High-quality offset prints of this drawing at full, one-to-one ratio size are available with certain packages.
 What does the book contain?
336 pages of EVERYTHING ink or pencil that I can still reproduce, from my TSR days through last week! Here's some "layout spread" sample pages. We're busily putting the book together to be ready to print as soon as funding comes in. The guidelines that you see in these images will not be in the printed book.
If we achieve a funding level in excess of $40K, I want to give all backer levels a set of five 8" x 10" black and white prints selected from among my favorite drawings.
If we achieve a funding level in excess of $75K, I can expand the book to the same size as the Complete Elmore color book, 336 pages! All books, both standard and leatherback editions, will be expanded to this larger size.
 If we achieve a funding level in excess of $90K, I will add an ADDITIONAL set of five prints (for a total of 10) to all backer tiers. Included will be the rarely-seen preliminary sketch for my very popular "Avalyne the Life-Giver" painting.
If we achieve a funding level in excess of $110K, I will invite all backers to come visit my studio in Leitchfield, KY, on a day TBA in 2016.
 If we achieve a funding level in excess of $125K, I will add an ADDITIONAL set of five prints (for a total of 15!) to all backer tiers, selected from among my favorite drawings. One drawing TBA if we near the goal!
ALL Original Drawing Packages include "The Works"--Leatherbound B&W book, standard edition B&W book, slipcase and print.
"LIGHTLY-COMMISSIONED" ORIGINAL DRAWING"
For these five packages (only) Larry will accept a simple fantasy or sci-fi suggestion from the backer, such as "sexy elf girl" or "dragon in flight" or "plate-armored cleric guy" or "Shadowrun guy with dual pistols" but not complex character descriptions, specific or especially copyrighted characters. For example, he will not accept "Everquest girl" or "Sturm from Dragonlance" or "Zelda". As these will be a large part of his new work into next year, Larry wants these to be drawings he can make prints of to sell at conventions. The lighter the suggestion the better. Ideally, tell him, "Do something cool."
IMPORTANT!!! --THIS DRAWING WILL NOT BE STARTED UNTIL 2016--
The other package rewards will ship in October like everyone else's, but the drawing will be completed and shipped separately sometime next year. International backers at this level will not be asked to pay additional postage for this separate 2016 mailing of the drawing, only the amount for shipping the books and print.
SMALL "NON-COMMISSION" DRAWING PACKAGE
These ten packages include "pot-luck" original Elmore drawing. It will be whatever comes out of Larry's brain when he sits down to do it. It may be pencil, ink or a combination. It may be a girl, a guy, a dragon head, a critter, etc. Some samples of drawings Larry did as part of the color art book campaign are included below. Larry intends to include the drawing with the book shipped in October, but as October is on the tail end of convention season he may have to mail it separate if they don't get done in time.
SAMPLES from first project--these are not the drawings included
OTHER ORIGINAL DRAWING PACKAGES
NOTE: Many of these drawings are completed on tracing paper (or vellum, a thick, high-quality tracing paper) as part of Larry's creative process. They are best framed over white backing paper.)
 Package includes one original Elmore drawing.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have learned a lot from our other projects. On this project we decided to offer a sleek, clean set of packages that will cut down on the complications that caused so many delays in the other projects. We also will have the book laid out and ready to go to press the instant the Kickstarter ends. This is not to say that we can eliminate EVERY possible problem or delay, but we have certainly minimized them and anticipate a fast fulfillment.

SCHEDULE
This book will ship to Kickstarter supporters in October 2015.

DOMESTIC SHIPPING 
All pledge amounts include USPS Media Mail shipping within the United States.

INTERNATIONAL SHIPPING
- There are limited ways for us to ship internationally. Because these are heavy books, we are unable to ship using the cheaper first-class mail option which has size restrictions and a four pound limit. International orders have to be shipped using International Priority Mail, which is, unfortunately, expensive. Additionally, the large cover print included with certain packages has to be shipped in a separate, heavy-duty tube, which is not a standard container size and costs as much to ship as the book. I truly value my international fans and I apologize that we have to pass this expense along to you. 
- Please do not provide P.O. Box addresses. We cannot ship to international post office boxes, only street addresses.
- Taxes and fees vary by country. Please be aware international orders may be required to pay a duty tax by your local postal station.

For more artwork by Larry Elmore log on to http://larryelmore.com/
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Two years ago, I produced a large coffee-table book on "The Art of Bob Peak."  The book was a Labor of Love and something I just had to do in celebration of my father's illustrious career.  The book proved to be an overwhelming success with an endless stream of orders throughout the United States and from around the World.  I Thank all of you Bob Peak aficionados for purchasing a copy of the book. As a follow-up, I thought Bob Peak enthusiasts, artist, illustrators, art students, and designers would be interested in a book showcasing "The Drawings of Bob Peak."  This 160 page oversized soft cover book (14" x 11") curated collection of his best drawings is a comprehensive look into a rarely viewed side of Bob Peak with never before seen charcoal, graphite, art market, pen, ink, pencil, and pastel drawings from the maestro himself.  This oversized book will take on the look and feel of the actual artwork with drawings large enough to study and admire the draftsmanship of the artist Bob Peak.  A "Collectors Edition" of (200 copies/100 sold through Kickstarter campaign) is also available.  Produced by Art Works Fine Arts Publishing which also produced the original "The Art of Bob Peak" book, this new book will be the same high quality that you expect and I require.  I will not produce anything surrounding the legacy of my father Bob Peak that does not meet with the highest quality and standards.  I appreciate your pledge backer support.
WE HAVE NOW ADDED A NEW GOAL AWARD FOR PLEDGES OF $32 AND UP. We really want to hit our Funding Goal of $27,000 so we're adding even more incentive to pledge. These high quality Giclee's are valued at $69 each. So the more you pledge the more value you're getting from these incredible Bob Peak Giclee Prints.
NEW GOAL REWARDS
Here is the Reward for Pledges of $200 or more. Exclusive "Collectors Edition" set of four (limited to 50) Bob Peak Movie Comp Giclee Drawings emboss signed and numbered in attractive Folder.
Collectors Edition" set of four
 Here are the pieces included in the set.
Apocalypse Now
My Fair Lady
Islands In The Stream
Sphinx
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
With any project comes potential unforeseen issues and obstacles. This is just part of the territory when producing anything, in this case an art book. Back in 2012 when producing "The Art of Bob Peak" book, Richard "Blue" Trimarchi at Art Works Fine Arts Publishing and myself met all challenges and obstacles head on and successfully maneuvered our way to complete the project and produce (what has become) an enormously successful book that we are both extremely proud of. It is an excellent representation of my father's enormous career, and one I know my father would have been extremely pleased with. On this new book venture (to date) all of the original Bob Peak Drawings for the book have been scanned and catagorized in a data base that has been selected from as we move forward with the project. We are right on schedule and expect to have the book ready to be printed and bound way before the completion of the Kickstarter 50 Day Campaign. Updates and visual images of the progress of the book will be posted on Kickstarter on regular intervals so that you can see our progress. If we do come across any unforeseen challenged or obstacles that might delay the books completion date, you WILL BE ADVISED. We are both extreme excited about this new Bob Peak book venture. This new Bob Peak book cannot be completed without your greatly needed "Kickstarter" Pledge Support. As I have said before, "I will not produce anything surrounding the legacy of my father Bob Peak's remarkable career that does not meet with the highest standards."
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Greetings!
I, much like most artists, have enjoyed drawing, coloring and creating art since I was a wee lad. For a time, I decided that I really should try being a responsible adult, and went to school for non-art, adult things, and began a far more “responsible” career. Soon, however, I found that I couldn’t stop doodling, and creating. Art just kept calling to me. So I went back to school to learn more about my true passion, and began allowing myself to do that which I really loved. I graduated from art school in 2009, and have been working toward my artistic goals ever since. These goals include original art, fan art, concept art, commissions, and the creation of my own independent comic book.
 I have been very fortunate to have lots of support along my journey, and now I want to share with you some of the memories, and works I’ve collected along the way. Thanks for being a part of my dream!
Here are some more examples of what you will find in this art book.
Pinups!
Pinup interior example
 Heroes
Heroes interior example
Comic book pages, layouts and notes.
Comic book sample page
 Sketches
Sketch sample
 and so much more! Over 100 images as well as notes on how I work.
So why should you support this art book? Well, first of all, supporting this art book means that I can share more of my artistic adventures with more people, and lets face it we all need to see people who have had similar struggles, and dreams. They are very inspiring. 
Second, have you ever wanted to look more sophisticated, and have a fancy coffee table book, but wanted art that was a bit more fun than the typical gallery stuff? Then this is the book for you. It looks great, and the art is dynamic, fun and satisfies the more discerning palate of the comic geek. 
If you don’t love the book, or get too bored with it after a while, it can always serve to support the coffee table that may be a little wobbly, or it can serve in the capacity of paper weight, paper flattener, beverage coaster, and many other creative uses. Clearly, you can’t go wrong getting this book.
 Lastly supporting my art book, regardless of the amount of your pledge, helps me to further my dream, which in turn makes you my hero. Being a hero is both personally rewarding, and looks good on a resume.
WHAT THE MONEY WILL BE USED FOR?
The artwork accumulated for this project covers several years, and so far everything for my art has been an out of pocket expense, from pencils, paper, and erasers, to a computer, proper programs, advertising, and marketing.
Now it's time to take it to the next level, and I need your help!
By supporting my art, not only do you get the benefit of a bit more beauty in your life, but you help me to become better known, which in turn helps me to help more people that may be in need of feedback for their work, beginning artists who may be interested in learning a few things to help them hone their skills, and in producing more art and beauty in the world.
The money will be used to pay for the printing of the art books, as well as the cost of delivering them to your door.
(Remember, you will not be charged until the end of the campaign on April 2nd and ONLY if the goal is met. )
The rewards:
Update (3/4/15) New Reward added. See Level 9 below)
Lvl 1 – $1 Heart felt Thank you. This is truly heartfelt as I would not be progressing forward as a commercial artist without your support.
Lvl 2 - $5 Heart felt thank you, and listed as a donor in the back of the book!
Lvl 3- $15 A heart felt thank you. your name listed as a donor in the back of the book AND a PDF of the entire book emailed to you!
Lvl 4- $25 A copy of the book delivered to your door WITH your name listed as a donor in the back of the book!
Book cover sample
 Lvl5- $30 A copy of the book SIGNED by artist Matt Campbell and delivered to your door WITH your name listed as a donor in the back of the book!
Lvl6- $40 A copy of the book SIGNED by artist Matt Campbell and delivered to your door WITH your name listed as a donor in the back of the book AND a custom made bookmark made by the artist. (See below for an example of bookmarks)
Bookmark example
 Lvl7- $50 A copy of the book SIGNED by artist Matt Campbell and delivered to your door WITH your name listed as a donor in the back of the book AND an 8.5X11 head sketch of your favorite character made by the artist.
Lvl8- $125 A copy of the book SIGNED by artist Matt Campbell and delivered to your door WITH your name listed as a donor in the back of the book AND an 11x14" original art of Riley Scott. (Limited to only 1, obviously)
Original Riley Scott art
 Lvl9- $125 A copy of the book SIGNED by artist Matt Campbell and delivered to your door WITH your name listed as a donor in the back of the book AND an 11x17" original art of Pg 8 of Mythica issue 1 signed by Matt Campbell. (Limited to only 1, obviously)

campaign.story:
Welcome back to Paperfilms 8th Kickstarter project : ABBADON. 
ABBADON is a 72 page MATURE AUDIENCES graphic novel written by Justin Gray & Jimmy Palmiotti from the original screenplay by Spencer Marstiller, featuring the art of FABRIZIO FIORENTINO and ALESSIA NOCERA and design and lettering by JOHN J. HILL. 
STRETCH GOAL ADDED!!
With just over a week left and the first stretch goal hit, we figured it was time to announce the second stretch goal!
If we hit $50k by the end of the campaign we will be giving everyone at every level a seperate digital FABRIZIO FIORENTINO sketch book that will include the character designs- layouts-breakdowns-alternate pages and commentary. This will be a real inside look to the thoughts and process that make up the final product. On the main page you can get a taste of some of the original sketches and how amazing Fabrizios work looks before it goes to finishes. This book will be designed by John J Hill and will be delivered before the final book to get everyone excited ahead of time. If we hit the 50k, expect some more stretch goals to come, and thanks everyone for all your social media and word of mouth. It really has made a difference.
cover by TIM BRADSTREET!
The Basics: Fans of our run on JONAH HEX and ALL STAR WESTERN are in for a treat as we offer a hard hitting and graphic, yet intensely dramatic character driven story in the same genre, free of any existing rating systems. 
 With this graphic novel adaption of a screenplay by Spencer Marstiller, we introduce an unconventional western set in a town where illicit sex, gambling and even murder are legal under the right conditions.  The story art gorgeously illustrated  by FABRIZIO FIORENTINO, whom we collaborated with on ALL STAR WESTERN and this is complimented by the lush digital painting of  ALESSIA NOCERA. Also featured is a dynamic and beautiful cover by award winning illustrator TIM BRADSTREET , with special reward catagories featuring a special limited edition mystery cover by multiple Eisner and Shuster Award winner DARWYN COOKE and another special cover by award winning and fan favorite artist  AMANDA CONNER. We are happy to also announce our new partnership with  the awesome crew at ADAPTIVE  STUDIOS . 
This entire square bound SOFTCOVER book will be a total of 72 pages plus material printed on the best paper stock available and printed in the USA. We need to raise the amount featured to cover production handling and distribution costs involved in producing an original graphic novel this big and beautiful. 
The inspiration for this project comes from our love of mature westerns, murder mysteries and the horror genre as well as the original unpublished screenplay it is based on. This was a project we fell in love with immediately. 

THE STORY:

“In the distance the silhouette of a sprawling boomtown rises ominously from the earth like a gravestone risen from Hell.”
  Set in the late 1880’s American West, Abbadon is a city steeped in sin, where anything is possible if you have the money, influence and power to obtain it. Poised to become the next boomtown, Abbadon is plagued by a series of murders heralding the arrival of U.S. Marshall Wes Garrett. A legendary lawman, Garrett’s claim to fame is that he killed a notorious murderer, who cut a bloody swath across the country and left scores of mutilated men, women and children in his wake. Garrett’s arrival exposes the secret that Abbadon’s sheriff Colt Dixon has desperately been trying to conceal – the victims have all been mutilated the same way they were by the killer Garret stopped – a man some called a monster, but the papers called him Bloody Bill. Garrett and Dixon join forces to uncover the killer’s identity in a town so full of corruption that everyone is a suspect.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The Kickstarter for ABBADON exists not only to raise funds to put together the book and album, but to create an EXCLUSIVE Kickstarter project that is unique in a few ways. We will be using Print-On-Demand structure to create an exclusive limited and signed editions of the book based solely on the amount of orders we receive which will then be printed in the America by American companies. 

This Kickstarter project will be the only place to get this specific edition and unique edition.

Eventually we plan to publish the book elsewhere for retailers with a different cover and contents, but till that time in the future, it will only be available here for our Kickstarter supporters! As you can see with the pledge list there are several choices on how you can make ABBADON a reality and share this amazing story and art. 

We will be adding more tier rewards as the pledge drive goes along, as well as stretch goals once, God willing, the original goal has been funded.

Many of you are returning customers who have supported us in the past and have received your Kickstarter pledges mostly ON TIME and hopefully have appreciated our communication throughout the project. For those who are returning for another adventure, we thank you from the bottom of our collective hearts.

For those new to this project and our books, we want to say we treat each and every person like a close friend, reply to your messages and do our best to make sure you have a positive and rewarding experience worth your time and generous backing. We are proud of our work, the artists and designers we collaborate with and especially proud of the fine women and men that support our ventures. 

 Because of that, we offer a big THANK YOU to everyone out there from all of us at PaperFilms and our creative partners on this project, the crew at Adaptive studios. 

Feel free to visit us on social media or via our website, www.paperfilms.com and adaptivestudios.com for more about each company!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Thanks to all of our generous backers, The Art of Ralph McQuarrie ARCHIVES is going to happen! It's not too late to become part of the campaign—check below for our stretch goals, the first two of which have been unlocked!
Best known for his instrumental contributions to the making of the original Star Wars trilogy, Ralph McQuarrie has inspired several generations of film fans and artists. While much of his Star Wars artwork has been reproduced in numerous volumes over the years, his non-Star Wars work has previously only been available in The Art of Ralph McQuarrie, a limited edition that we (Dreams and Visions Press) published in 2007. That book is long out of print and now commands high prices on the secondary market. 
With The Art of Ralph McQuarrie: ARCHIVES, we will bring back into print a career-spanning retrospective of Ralph McQuarrie’s non-Star Wars artwork. At 13” x 9.5”, this 432-page volume is not only offered at a more affordable price point than our original 2007 release, one third of the content is original to this edition. That's hundreds of Ralph McQuarrie illustrations spanning all aspects of his body of work.
TRADE EDITION COVER DESIGN - NOT FINAL
We've been hard at work on the book for the past several months. Our efforts have not just been focused on assembling new art, but upgrading source materials where possible, and doing additional research to provide more details on many of the pieces within, both new and old. We are on track to finalize the book this summer, after which we will hand it off to the printer to meet our target release date.
The book will be available in two states: 1) a hardcover version with printed covers and 2) a deluxe clothbound individually numbered limited edition housed in a clothbound presentation traycase. Each copy will be smyth-sewn with head and tail bands to provide a sturdy binding that will last for years to come.
DELUXE EDITION CONCEPT (BOOK WILL BE BOUND ON THE LEFT)
The Art of Ralph McQuarrie: ARCHIVES contains examples of Ralph's work in each of the following areas: Early technical illustration, movie posters, book covers, film and television production, other commercial illustration and a selection of personal pieces. In many cases we have examples of work that demonstrate Ralph's process, from his tiniest thumbnails to larger sketches, color comps and ultimately his finished paintings. 
Here are a handful of two-page spreads from the book (the actual size of these spreads will be 26" x 9.5"):
Technical Illustration
Movie Posters
Book Covers
Film Concept Art
Commercial Illustration
Personal Work
Backers at the $75 level and above including the regular hardcover edition of ARCHIVES will receive a 10" x 8" bookplate signed by the authors with the cleaned up version of Ralph's 'Power of God' illustration.
Kickstarter exclusive bookplate concept for regular hardcover
Backers at the $150 level and above including the deluxe hardcover edition of ARCHIVES will also receive an 8" x 10" bookplate signed by the authors featuring a drawing to painting rendition of Ralph's first paperback cover for Ballantine Books.
Kickstarter exclusive bookplate concept for deluxe hardcover
While ARCHIVES will be an essential volume in its own right, this book will also be a perfect companion to the previous books of Ralph's art that we've published through the years (which are available in some of the reward packages offered):
The Art of Ralph McQuarrie
Our first book. A huge, 15" x 12" 400-page slipcased volume covering Ralph's entire body of work. One-third of the book is dedicated to Ralph's contributions to the original Star Wars trilogy.
The Star Wars Art of Ralph McQuarrie (Japanese)
Celebrating the 30th anniversary of Star Wars in Japan in 2008, this 168-page 12" x 9" trade paperback remains the largest single-volume collection of Ralph's Star Wars art published to date. The text is in Japanese, but that doesn't prevent one from enjoying page after page of Ralph's glorious contributions to the Star Wars saga. We provide an English language translation of the text as a PDF via email.
A Gallery of Imagination
A 48-page 8.5" x 11" fully illustrated trade paperback guide to a 2010 gallery exhibit of dozens of Ralph's rare Star Wars illustrations.
Remembering Ralph McQuarrie
A 48-page 8.5" x 11" trade paperback celebrating the life and work of Ralph McQuarrie. Profusely illustrated with previously unseen images, with remembrances from Ralph's colleagues, friends, and fans, including: Hal Barwood, Phil Tippett, Jon Berg, Harrison Ellenshaw, Doug Chiang, Kevin J. Anderson, James Gurney, Lawrence Noble, Tim Bradstreet, Ken Steacy and more.
Battlestar Galactica 35th Anniversary Portfolio
Modeled after the Ballantine portfolios of the late 70s and early 80s, this 13" x 11" illustrated folio contain a set of 24 production paintings that Ralph created for the classic Battlestar Galactica pilot film.
No fan of Ralph McQuarrie, science fiction and fantasy illustration, or concept artwork will want to be without this ultimate collection of a brilliant artist's body of work.
As with all Kickstarter projects, we only receive the funds raised if we meet our funding goal, so we need your help in this epic undertaking. We hope you'll consider pledging your support at any level, and whether or not you're able to lend your support financially, we greatly appreciate your help spreading the word about our campaign to produce The Art of Ralph McQuarrie: ARCHIVES. 
To thank you for your support with this project, we have come up with a number of different backer rewards. Several items can also be included as add-ons (by adjusting your pledge amount accordingly). And if you’re interested in any of our extremely limited high-end items, you can always add the dollar amount to any of the lower levels - just let us know when you make your pledge in case we need to adjust our inventory numbers on limited items.
All pledge amounts include USPS Media Mail shipping with tracking within the U.S. Please note, this Kickstarter campaign is only available for shipping within the United States. PLEASE REVIEW OUR FAQ for an explanation as to why international shipping isn't being offered, and rest assured that international fans WILL be able to order copies of the book (including the deluxe edition) from our website provided that our campaign is successful.
STRETCH GOALS
REWARD LEVELS
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
In the seven years since we published our first book, The Art of Ralph McQuarrie, we have successfully produced several other book projects on-time and within budget, including the two-volume Art of Tomb Raider, several more books on Ralph McQuarrie and his art, and a portfolio of paintings from the 1978 Battlestar Galactica television series.

We are always evaluating lessons learned from prior publishing projects to ensure each subsequent product we produce is the best it can be. While we are conservative with our delivery estimates, a publication schedule can be impacted by forces outside of our direct control. Additionally, we pride ourselves on the high quality of our products, and in the rare instance that they fail to meet our rigorous quality standards when received from the printer, that can require re-work. We're confident that we have selected the appropriate partner to bring The Art of Ralph McQuarrie: Archives to market meeting our high quality standards.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
DENVER is a graphic novel about one man going against all odds to get back the woman he loves, all set in the not-too-distant future.
STRETCH GOALS! 
We are adding a few here, and more later. For now…
$34 Grand: If we hit this amount, EVERYONE will be getting the original DIGITAL script of DENVER added to their pledge. For those that pledged the digital script level, we will be giving you a bonus script. 
$38 Grand: We will be adding a sketchbook section to the book in both Paper and Digital format. This will feature a nice amount of sketches by Pier as he was worldbuilding the book and the character sketches, and will up the page count of the final book. 
$40 Grand: RANDOM BACKER SKETCHES: In the non-digital pledges, We will be randomly inserting sketches into peoples packages on a random basis. Pier will be doing 15 sketches and we will be collecting some here and there from our crew including Amanda Conner and Jimmy. Some will be of scenes and characters in the book, some will be really really random, but fun! 
$50 Grand level: In the non digital pledges, we will be giving everyone a print of the AMANDA CONNER special limited cover. In the digital section we will include it in your book. This will be unsigned. 
We will be adding some ideas along the way and inbetween these stretch goals, but for now it is a start. 
We have been getting a lot of Hardcover requests, but since we print the book in the U.S. it's very expensive and harder still with the weight change to ship overseas. We are not counting it out, but we are looking at all the expenses and right now, we are far from there on this. Stay tuned. 
My buddy Antonio suggested if we hit 100 grand to make a hardcover, so thats the stretch goal for that…a hardcover and added story pages if we hit 100 grand. Is it possible? Probably not, but what a good dream. 
Welcome back to the PaperFilms 6th Kickstarter project: DENVER
DENVER is an EXCLUSIVE TO KICKSTARTER 72-page MATURE AUDIENCES graphic novel written by Justin Gray & Jimmy Palmiotti, featuring the amazing art of PIER BRITO, and lettering and design by Bill Tortolini. All of this is brought to you by the PAPERFILMS team that has delivered QUEEN CRAB, FORAGER, WEAPON OF GOD, RETROVIRUS, and SEX AND VIOLENCE. 
We are very proud of our track record with past Kickstarters, and we know you will be happy with this one as well. With this project we added a really cool feature: a soundtrack! Read on…
Wrap around cover by Pier Brito
PREMISE: After a rogue meteor impacts our moon, forcing it off its regular orbit, the oceans rise dramatically, consuming most of the planet’s surface. The United States is under water, with the exception of its last major metropolis: Denver, Colorado. This is not the horrible post-apocalypse world we are used to. It is a showcase of mankind’s greatest achievements and ability to survive, but as always, there needs to be control and regulation in a city that can only house and feed a specific number of citizens. There are those outside this great city who would do just about anything to get in. That is where our main character MAX FLYNN comes in.
Max is one of many armed Coast Border Guards [CBG] who protects and processes everything coming into and leaving DENVER. He lives with his new wife, Betty, and his teenage daughter from a previous marriage, Trinity. On the job, Max has command of his two partners, Jimmy DePaul and Jane Nelson. Their job is to route everything and everyone that enters the city from the waterways, inclusive of new citizens seeking refuge in DENVER. In this futuristic world, masses of people are wandering the earth’s waterways in hopes of gaining admission to some of the few cities left, and DENVER is no different. They keep a constant population count by monitoring every time a citizen of DENVER dies; an open space is available for either a birth or granting an outsider citizenship in DENVER. This person would have to be sponsored by an active resident.
Unfortunately there are those who would do just about anything to gain entry into DENVER. The burden of stopping this falls upon Max and the CBG. Our story is about a group that goes to such extremes, and Max is forced to go against everything he has ever learned and been trained for.
DENVER is a story about extortion, betrayal, and the lengths a person will go to, to protect the ones they love. DENVER was born out of a love for adult sci-fi stories, drawing its inspiration from films like BLADE RUNNER, SOYLENT GREEN, and ROAD WARRIOR, and a lifetime of reading HEAVY METAL MAGAZINE—as well as being brought up having hope in mankind.
             THE SOUNDTRACK : 
The soundtrack. Yes, we have added an actual soundtrack to complete the experience of the graphic novel, written and composed by Hans Karl. A sample runs with the video above and this soundtrack was written based on the Denver graphic novel.
To listen to a track from the Denver soundtrack, go to: 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sdEpiQGfd7w
 Hans Karl is a film and multimedia composer. His music can be heard in documentaries, animated shorts, indie film, commercial jingles and various other creative media projects. In addition to his scoring work, he has also released several albums in various music genres. Currently, he has been creating a collection of original music library tracks. He resides in Los Angeles. You can find out more about Hans at his website:  http://www.hanskarlmusic.com
 Also featured on the soundtrack is the ending credit song: “ You Do”, written and performed by Carrie Johnson. Carrie is a professional songwriter and performer who spends time writing and recording in Hartford, CT and Nashville, TN. The Carrie Johnson Band performs regularly in the New England area.  Please visit her site at: http://www.carriejohnsonmusic.com
 Please visit her site at: http://www.carriejohnsonmusic.com
Her main accomplishments include: • BMI songwriter with over 200 songs in her catalog, including over 20 co-writes with current performing aritsts • Eight cd's of original music (including 22 Brides): “Selling Fruit in Cairo”; “22 Brides”; “Beaker”; “Blazes of Light”; Demolition Day”; “Geographical Fix”; “Move The Sun”; “Strength To Move”; and various singles released • Published composer for film: Orenda Films “No Way Home” and independent film “Exposure”, and animated film "Ferretina - The Promise" • Professional studio vocalist and rhythm guitarist (artists include Paula Abdul, Deborah Gibson, and Belinda Carlisle) 
HERE ARE SOME SAMPLE PAGES: 
INTERIOR PAGES
 BELOW ARE THE PRINT OPTIONS, WITH THE NAMES OF THE ARTISTS CLEARLY MARKED ON THE ART. 
The names will not be on the actual prints. The print size is 10 x 6 1/2 inches. They are on thick watercolor paper stock.
REWARD 19, LIMITED TO 10.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The Kickstarter for DENVER exists not only to raise funds to put together the book and album, but to create an EXCLUSIVE Kickstarter project that is unique in several ways. We will be using Print-On-Demand structure to create an exclusive limited and signed editions of the book based solely on the amount of orders we receive, which will be printed in the U.S.A. This process uses the best quality paper and cover stock we can get. It will be the same as our past graphic novels, but with more pages. 

This Kickstarter project will be the only place to get the package rewards offered. Eventually we plan to publish the book elsewhere for retailers with a different cover, but till that time in the future, it will only be available here for our Kickstarter supporters! 

As you can see with the reward tier list, there are several choices on how you can get the book. We will be adding more tier rewards as the pledge drive goes along, as well as stretch goals once the original goal has been funded. Many of you are returning customers who have supported us in the past and have received your Kickstarter pledges mostly ON TIME and hopefully have appreciated our communication throughout those projects. 

For those who are returning for another adventure, WE THANK YOU! For those new to this project and our books, we want to say we treat each and every person like a close friend, reply to your messages and do our best to ensure you get each penny’s worth of pledge amount, not just this project, but all of our projects. 

We are proud of our work however we are even more proud of the fine people that support us on our adventures! Because of that, we offer a big THANK YOU to everyone out there from all of us at PaperFilms….all 6 of us! 

Finally, any additional help you can support us with this campaign by posting, tweeting and spreading the word about this project, the entire DENVER team appreciates.

NOTE:Due to the increased cost for international shipping, we are offering the option to ship overseas, however, the shipping cost will be higher than our previous campaigns. We certainly love and appreciate our overseas fans, however, we have to account for the extreme handling structures and the current postal increases. 

Feel free to visit us on social media or via our website, www.paperfilms.com Thanks again!
