campaign.story:
If you missed out on the SnarfQuest: New Adventures, don't worry, log on to my website... http://www.larryelmore.com
CHANGE OF ADDRESS for BACKERS ONLY!!!
If you have a change of address before this product ships, please send your new home address to snarfchangeofaddress@gmail.com (you will get an email back letting you know we received it.)
 Snarf's New Adventures!
Several years ago I started on a new Snarf adventure for Games Unplugged Magazine. They published 36 pages before the magazine was sold to a new publisher who decided not to continue the strip. This year (2013) I was approached by Kenzer & Company to reprint the strip in the Knights of the Dinner Table Comic. I also promised to finish the story, and this is where I need your help.

I really need to take two to three months to finish off the story with 24 to 36 additional pages. That will make a wonderful 64-page full color graphic novel (give or take a few pages).  
Depending on your pledge amount you can own this book as a softbound or hardback edition, as well as other bonuses, such as special prints, or even the original drawing used for the front or back cover! Most importantly, you are helping me bring a brand new Snarf adventure to life. Thank you for backing me.
We wanted to offer you some of the best rewards we could, and in fact, many of the rewards that we’ve put together were requested by fans! 
From $1.00-$100, we’ve kept things pretty simple.  Above $100, the choices get a lot harder and rarer. 

SnarfQuest d20 Hardback 
ORIGINAL SALES TEXT: Looking to add some humor to your current d20 campaign, or need to get reacquainted with the misadventures of your favorite Zeetva? This hardback book is 128 pages and packed full of d20 material; including new prestige classes, feats, skills, DM advice and comical adventure hooks. All hail the return of Snarf! 
This 128-page 6" x 9" Hardback was released in 2003 for the d20 3.0 table top WOTC game system. Larry has about 150 of these left and would like to offer it to you for a mere $10 extra. They will be signed by Larry. 

If you want this book, simply increase your pledge and choose the new rewards package. It's that simple.
Note: International backers have to add an additional $10 for shipping.
A DONATION is a $1 pledge that allows you to order certain items a la carte, although any pledge level can also do so. ADD-ONs are those items. 
For example, if you pledged at $50 and also wanted a the Original Graphic Novel Expansion, you would add $30 to your $50 pledge for a total of $80. Or, You could make a donation of $1 and just add on the Snarf miniatures for $25 for a total of $26.    
Instructions: When you go to pledge, put the total number you are pledging (including any ADD-ONS) into the box at the top of the page, then select your desired reward level.
Snarf Miniatures .................................$25 US / $35 International
Original Graphic Novel Expansion ..... $30
SnarfQuest New Adventures softback... $25  / $35 International
SnarfQuest New Adventures softback withe Original SnarfQuest graphic novel included... $55 / $65 International
Snarf Miniatures
Our friends at Iron Wind Metals have the original set of RAL PARTHA miniatures collecting dust. So we decided to remaster the molds and make the minis available 20 years after their original release. Now these are limited and will only be produced for Kickstart Backers!!! We have no plans to release these again.

ORIGINAL SALES TEXT: Miniatures from RAL PARTHA are supplied unpainted and assembly may be required. 25mm scale metal miniatures. Contains: 11 miniatures
The original set sold for $25 and normally sells on eBay for $35 to $40. We are going to keep the original price of $25 for the U.S. and $35 for International. Shipping is included!!!
If you want a set of minis, simply add $25 or $35 to your original pledge.  As soon as this Kickstart is over you will be sent a survey. Just click the box stating you bought the minis. Pretty simple!  NOTE: Original box is not included.  
 Original SnarfQuest Graphic Novel
Many of you have asked about the original SnarfQuest Graphic Novel and pleaded to make it available in the add-ons section. I have been reluctant to do so because so many SnarfQuest books have been produced and I believe that Kickstart is a place to get unique items. So Ken and I sat down and brainstormed and came up with a compromise for you guys.
For $30 extra we will place the original 224 page B&W graphic novel in the front of your new hardback or soft back book making it nearly 300 pages.
What makes this truly unique is that this is the only time I am going to offer this book in this format. If only twenty of you buy this double edition then only twenty will ever be made. Your book will have a special cover that may read like this... “This edition is a Kickstarter exclusive limited to X copies”.
Simply add an additional $30 to your pledge. When the Kickstart is over, you will be sent a survey. The survey will have a space to check that you got the expansion.
$20,000 -- 5 page color story that ran in Dragon Magazine in 2000.<<<<<<<<<<UNLOCKED!!!
$25,000 --  Studio Open House in July 2014.<<<<<<<<<<UNLOCKED!!!
$45,000--  SnarfQuest Tales digital game app with project updates and beta testing!<<<<<<<<<<UNLOCKED!!!
SnarfQuest Digital Game Announced
Cellbloc Studios has agreed to create a free countdown app for the game once the "Snarf's New Adventure" Kickstarter reaches its stretch goal of $45,000.
This countdown app will allow you guys to access the game's beta test, and include a 'developer diary' with regular updates on development milestones and screenshots of the game. What's nice about this app is that you guys, my loyal fans, will get to give actual input into how the game is developed.
How could I say no? So let's spread the word about Snarf and see if we can’t get this app!

updates.update_userinfo: PROJECT WRAP-UP
updates.update_content:
According to our records, all pledges have been fulfilled—Betty and Gary have shipped out all orders. But, as we learned from our first Kickstarter, some items get returned or addresses get changed and people lose contact. We have attempted to correct any returns but some people haven’t responded to our e-mails. If your pledge hasn’t been completely fulfilled, please contact Betty Elmore at bettyelmore4@gmail.com. We will cross-reference your pledge with our records to make sure you get all the items you pledged for.
To give you an idea of the overwhelming avalanche of e-mails generated by my three Kickstarter projects, my inbox currently has 30,000 e-mails from Kickstarter alone. Many of these e-mails are automatically generated by Kickstarter as notification of every little unimportant detail regarding any of the pledges made by my almost 5000 backers. Finding any single important message among this mess is time-consuming and almost impossible, which is why we would prefer you to contact Betty directly at her personal address with any lingering problems or questions.

campaign.story:
The Protocol game series is a collection of roleplaying games stripping away all pretense and getting to the heart of storytelling. Each game uses the same basic mechanics — vignettes, interrogations, interludes, and ensembles — to tell non-derivative stories. Every player has all the tools he or she needs to create interesting characters and environments for their favorite stories.
Every game stands alone. Every game shares a commonality.
Essentially what I've done with Toolcards, I am now doing with roleplaying games. Inspiration and new ideas mixed with something you already know how to do. The Protocol game series uses a simple method of shared storytelling with charts, motivations, character interaction, and plot.
In the Protocol game series, each story explores disparate characters dealing with adversity in a dramatic fashion.There are 15 games in the series — 13 of them are already completed and backers will have an opportunity to vote on the last 2 games.
Each game is 10-15 pages long, including charts, and rules.
A single game is only $3.
"Protocol game series looks interesting and it has everything players could want in a series of games for an evening or two (maybe more)."
"It offers mystery, intrigue, science fiction, fantasy, spies, mercenaries and other genre. Having played a session of Home, the game was easy to set up and fun to partake in with just two players setting up the story, interludes, and vignettes. It's simply that good of an idea. I like it."
– Tim Bisaillon
All of the Protocol Games use the same basic mechanic, but with very different results. Games can be played with or without a gamemaster, though without is the best method. Players only need paper, pencil, and a deck of cards. No dice are necessary. Some kind of token for drama point can help, but aren't necessary.
An example of Protocol game play appears in the first update.
There are 15 games in the Protocol series, but backers can choose any number of games to support. Merely pick a level and when the project is over, you'll be sent a survey asking you which games you want and if you want to add anything else to your order. If you're doing add-ons, it's easier if you do that before the Kickstarter ends.
Since all of the games in the Protocol game series use the same rules, consider mixing and matching the charts for a universe-bending story.
Home is a story roleplaying game about soldiers in a fantasy world returning home from a long and costly war. With only a few coins in their pockets, they must start the long trek back to their homeland. Being on the losing side of the war, the characters must overcome adversity, national tension, and a lack of resources as they navigate the lands separating them from their homeland.
Black Site is a story roleplaying game about rendition and torture. Players take on the roles of people trapped in rendition, arrested without warrant, and held for an indeterminate amount of time. As the characters work to fend off their accusers, the story explores menacing sides of the human psyche. Not for kids.
Joan of Arc is a story roleplaying game about scientists and rescue personnel working to save a damaged space station before disruptive energy rips it apart. Starting from the planet’s surface, the team has limited time to get to the station, climb inside, and repair the damaged station. The clock is ticking as problem after problem besets the team members who have limited resources to battle the ravaged reactor core.
Power Station is a story roleplaying game in which players take on the roles of world leaders with access to unfathomable fuel sources, while neighboring nations covet their power. Set in a near-future world, Power Station asks questions of responsibility and power. Will hubris be your nation's undoing? Or will you use the power responsibly and usher in a new era of human achievement?
Perdition is a story roleplaying game about frontier settlers dealing with the fears of the unknown. Players take on the role of a family or pair of families staking their claim on the new land. Though it is designed with an American West focus, the game can easily be adapted to any frontier, including a colony on a faraway planet awaiting resupply.
 Chebyshev Function is a story roleplaying game about teenagers with psionic powers —known as primes — who are chased by the government. Forced to live outside the convenience of modern life, the characters must “go underground” to protect themselves from those who would do them harm. As the story progresses, the teenagers find themselves face to face with very real dangers that will test them, their friendships, and their will to live.
Devil's Highway is a story roleplaying game in which players take on the roles of bikers in a “motorcycle club.” Living just beyond the reach of the law, the bikers are involved in drugs, gun running, theft, and generally lawless behavior. Recently there has been a change in leadership that has caused some concerns for the club, both internally and externally.
Coyote is a story roleplaying game about immigrants being smuggled into a new nation of opportunity. This game deals with themes of prejudice and segregation, while shining a light on work ethics and cultural division. Though the game is designed to take place in an industrialized society, it also has flexibility for fantasy or science fiction settings.
Calendar Man is a story roleplaying game about a serial killer who cannot be caught. Mimicking films like Zodiac, Suspect Zero, and Silence of the Lambs, the murders are dark and ghastly, challenging everyone, police and journalists alike. In the end, can anyone solve the murders or does the Calendar Man walk away free?
Eons is a story roleplaying game about horrific evil beyond the realms of man. Or the stars. Not your father's mythos.
Need I say more?
Dinner Guests is a story roleplaying game about a dinner party that turns to murder. Done in the style of Agatha Christie, Murder by Death, and Clue, the Dinner Guest is a funny romp through a dinner, murder, and resolution. Will you be the aging British Lord with too much time on his hands, looking for excitement? Are you the spoiled niece who wants the inheritance all to herself? Or perhaps you'll play the confused house guest, way over your head in someone else's scheme?
Murder all you like… without getting your hands dirty.
Five Broken Swords is a story roleplaying game about a group of adventurers on an impossible quest that has been dragging on for years. The adventurers are old, tired, and ready to give up. But maybe the fabled relic lies in the next dungeon up ahead. Is it possible?

Each adventurer has a secret reason for being on the quest, which could usurp the journey. In the end, will you fail together? Succeed alone?
Nacht Engel is a story roleplaying game about 1960s East German authors trying to pass for artists while creating manifestos for the state. Meeting in secret and discussing the challenges of their lives under an oppressive state, the characters attempt to create meaning in their work, despite knowing the lies they must write. In the end, the players will decide if their subversive ways attract the state police or not.
The Protocol Game Series utilizes a regular deck of poker cards. Players are welcome to use any deck they already have or buy the custom protocol deck for only $12. The custom deck will have a unique deck back, art on the front, and scene type delineated on the face for ease of reference. Custom decks are just 52 cards and do not include scenario cards.
In addition, backers have the opportunity to purchase scenario specific decks (10 cards each) for ease of reference. No more carrying the book around. Now, just a poker deck and 10 cards and you can play your favorite Protocol game. Each deck is only $2, plus shipping. This can be done as an add-on or after the kickstarter is complete.
Custom Game $100
At $1000, the ability to order a custom game in the Protocol Series is available. You tell me what you want and I write it. I reserve the right to sell it to whomever and you reserve the right to give it away to your friends. Contact me directly for more information.
Toolcards
Toolcards are still available. Check this link and let me know which of these decks you are interested in.
http://www.kickstarter.com/projects/218255739/toolcards-fantasy-gm-cards
King for a Day $30/$60
Soft and Hardcover books are still available for $30 and $60 each, respectively. Fewer than 10 Hardcovers remain. For more information on King for a Day, visit
http://postworldgames.com/product/
Solomon Guild $30
Soft books are still available for $30. For more information on Solomon Guild, visit
http://postworldgames.com/product/
Dice $10
I have dice remaining from previous kickstarters. Just pick a color.
Each set is $10 for 5 dice. Add $5 for international shipping.
Space Station by Drew Baker
Elf and Elf/Orc Fight by Eric Lofgren
Dreadlocks Girl by Tamas Baranya
Stucco Hut by The Forge Studios
Dinner Guest and Nacht Engel by Felipe Gaona
Music by Kevin MacLeod

Holy Diver is a story roleplaying game homage to Ronnie James Dio. With characters and events drawn directly from the lyrics of Ronnie James Dio songs (from Rainbow, Black Sabbath, and his self-titled work), the game is a strange trip through the golden lyrics of the metal god himself. Specifically, the game is about fantasy adventurers on a quest to the Silver Mountain, to see ‘the Witch’.

campaign.story:
"It's really cool and it's really fun to play, and actually quite innovative ... I was impressed with Dragons of Elanthia."
TotalBiscuit, The Cynical Brit
Ten tons of angry, fire-breathing dragon, and you are in control! 
Dragons of Elanthia is a new, free-to-play, multiplayer aerial combat shooter unlike any other: Choose a dragon, pick a rider and soar into team-based battle! It's exactly the kind of game we've always wanted to play but had never seen before - certainly not like this. And with your help we can make it happen!
The game has already been in development for over ten months; we've made a lot of progress, and it shows. You can see exactly where we are heading, and more importantly, kick in your ideas on how to take it the rest of the way. Beta signups are already online, and be sure to vote for us on Steam Greenlight right now! 
These guys want your votes. That or they're just lining up a shot.
So let's start with the basics: Dragons are awesome, and flying is also awesome. Therefore, flying dragons around inside an active volcano is even more awesome. In fact, if we could sum up our approach to making this game, it would simply be "make it as cool as possible." Every decision our team makes pushes the game to be bigger, better, and more badass.
Emphasis on "bigger"...
The whole team loves shooters, but we're also big fans of strategy games. Because we make games we love playing, we've put a layer of strategic depth into Dragons of Elanthia. Our core mechanic is matching dragons with riders, so any given battle is just as much about finding the right combination of skills as it is about laying down some hurt on your enemies. But that's enough general talk; let's get into the actual gameplay!
"There's this neat little indie title called Dragons of Elanthia, and it's all about online multiplayer warfare between dragons and the daredevil jockeys who ride them."
Landon Robinson, Machinima's Inside Gaming Daily
When you join a match, you choose a dragon and a rider. Each one has three unique abilities, so every combination nets you six abilities total. Then it's all about wrecking the other team's day, whether that means capturing a strategic spot for your team, supporting your allies with healing and buffing, or just straight-up annihilating enemy dragon riders. When you inevitably get shot down, you can swap to a different dragon and/or rider, and jump right back into the fight.
The Lich riding a thematically appropriate Bone Drake into battle.
The really fun part is figuring out how to build the right combination of abilities, both for your own play style and for what's going on in the match right now. Every rider and every dragon has the same breakdown of abilities: two active and one passive. Usually that means one attack, one utility skill, and then something unique to that character for the passive.
The Shaman riding a Faerie Dragon, and deploying the dragon's Sprite Cloud countermeasures.
Most attacks require you to lock onto an enemy by keeping them in your crosshairs, so that your rider/dragon can properly aim the shot. Others will let you fire without a specific target, since massive fireballs and area-of-effect shockwaves don’t need to be quite as precisely aimed. And let's face it: The bigger the explosion, the better.
Many projectiles, like these missiles, will try to home in on enemies.
Utility skills vary widely from character to character, and largely define that rider or dragon’s role. You might have a healing ability, a team buff, a defensive shield ... it could be anything. But regardless of what your loadout is, there's always a way to contribute to the action.
"In addition to the generally amazing dragon-based aerial combat, there's an experience-based progression system to help you power up your dragon and rider, which impacts each independently."
Josh Vanderwall, The Escapist
Since Dragons of Elanthia is all about adapting your strategies on the fly, the real meat of the game is in our roster of riders and dragons. Currently we've got six dragons and six riders, giving you 36 combinations to pick from. And those numbers are only going to go up from here!
The Pirate riding a Lightning Drake through some lava-filled caves.
It's absolutely vital for you to feel the difference in every dragon and rider, and luckily we have a very talented team of artists to make sure these guys shine (in some cases literally). We nail the look, hand off the abilities to our brilliant gameplay programmers, and then rigorously test those abilities until they feel right. For some characters it's easy to strike this balance, but for others it can take weeks of fine-tuning.
Let's look at some of the specific riders and dragons we've created so far.
You can read more about our dragons and riders over at our site!
"Dragons of Elanthia adds a fantasy twist to a multiplayer shooter."
Megan Farokhmanesh, Polygon
Dragons of Elanthia is free-to-play, which means we don't charge you any money to play the full game with all dragons and riders. If you choose, you can support the game by buying cool customizations and boosts. We've had the unfortunate experience of playing games that turn out to be pay-to-win, and we don't intend to ruin the spirit of our game by giving an unfair advantage to a select few.
How can you put a price on this kind of maneuver?
If you do want to help support our server costs and the ongoing creation of maps, riders, and dragons you can spend your money on the following:
Boosting experience gains
Unlocking skins and other cosmetic items
Acquiring packs of random artifacts
As you can see, spending a ton of cash won't make you suddenly become good at the game. You can gain experience faster than normal, and get a better chance of obtaining the right artifact to boost your favorite dragon's attack. But you get all of these things by just playing the game longer. At the end of the day, Dragons of Elanthia is all about skill, strategy, action, and - most of all- fun.
It's all about vision. We haven’t seen anything out there like Dragons of Elanthia, and it's something we've always wanted to play. In fact, we've wanted to make this game for a long time, and it's only now that the technology has caught up with our concept. As game developers, we did what comes naturally and simply started making it on our own.
We think this game is special, and we want to keep it that way. And Kickstarter is the best way for us to do that. Not only do we avoid the headaches of working with a publisher who might not share our vision, but we get to reach out directly to all of you fine folks. And of course bringing you guys along with us on the journey is a nice bonus.
The journey will probably involve barrel rolls. Just a fair warning.
We've already produced tons of content, and spent a lot of time refining our gameplay, but we need your help to finish the game. And because we respect your time and money, all the money we collect goes directly into our ongoing development. The more we get, the more we can add:
More support for major platforms
More international infrastructure
More maps
More dragons
More riders
More skins
Can't contribute to our Kickstarter campaign but still want to help? Sign up for our beta and we'll get you in as soon as we can. And please vote for us on Steam Greenlight!
Today, Simutronics is made up of over 30 passionate gamers (and a few pets), working out of St. Louis, Missouri. Like most good things, the company started in the 80s. We’ve been making online multiplayer games since 1987, when our CEO David Whatley first released GemStone onto GEnie. Funny thing, the game is still up and running today, so you could say we know a thing or two about keeping online games running. And we also made one of the first online 3D shooters, CyberStrike, so there’s that. More recently, we've released a couple of mobile titles,Tiny Heroes and One Epic Knight. But we kept feeling the pull back toward online multiplayer ... so here we are with Dragons of Elanthia!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As experienced game developers we know that there are always potential snags in the production timeline, especially as we continue to add new environments, dragons and riders to the mix. We don’t foresee any particular trouble but it’s possible that the finished product could take longer than expected. Also, there’s always the worry about plagues of locusts and the occasional unexpected apocalypse.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.creator_bio:
Simutronics
First created · 6 backed
Simutronics is one of the oldest independent game studios in North America. We’ve been around for over 25 years and have made persistent...See more

updates.update_userinfo: A new rider and a test session tomorrow
updates.update_content:
Hi everyone! 
We've introduced a new rider to our roster: The Gladiator; read more about him here. Also, we're having another playtest tomorrow night (Thursday December 19) at 8pm EST. Come play with us, or watch our livestream on Twitch.

updates.update_userinfo: Campaign Conclusion
updates.update_content:
Hello Backers,
As our Kickstarter draws to a close, we are under 15% funded, and realize that it's just not going to happen this time around.  
That said, all of us at Simutronics want to thank you for your support, encouragement, and feedback. We couldn't have gotten this far without you, and we want to make sure you're along with us for the ride, wherever it takes us.

updates.update_userinfo: Alpha and the Future
updates.update_content:
Greetings, backers! If you haven’t checked your messages lately, take a look! All of you awesome backers are invited to our alpha, and we’ve given everyone keys to get into the game. Come on in and give it a try, and a big chunk of the team will be online tonight! And if you can't join the game yourself, check out our twitch stream of the testing!
Now, in less awesome news, the Kickstarter is drawing to a close, and obviously it doesn’t look so great right now. But don’t worry, we’re still looking at various plans to keep Dragons of Elanthia alive post-Kickstarter, because we do not want this game to die. No matter what happens, we’ll keep all of you posted!

updates.update_userinfo: Rider Preview: The Mage
updates.update_content:
Greetings, backers!  
Today's update includes a closer look at one of the first riders we designed for Dragons of Elanthia, The Mage. Unlike many of her companions, the Mage has no team support abilities. However, what she lacks in teamwork skills, she more than makes up for with a dependable and potentially devastating attack. Read more about her on our website.

updates.update_userinfo: Dragon Preview: The Behemoth
updates.update_content: In today's update, we take a closer look at the largest dragon in our roster, The Behemoth. Not only is he absolutely ginormous, but his high-firepower abilities essentially make him a tank with wings. For more on this massive and intimidating beast, check out the full writeup on our website.

updates.update_userinfo: Meet Adam Shaw, Sound Designer
updates.update_content: Hello, backers! We'd like to introduce you to Adam Shaw, our sound designer extraordinaire. In today's update, Adam details the process of providing sound for our games, including how he sources and creates sounds, the equipment he uses, and how his cat Nala is an integral part* of his work. We hope you find it enlightening and entertaining; visit our website for the full article!

updates.update_userinfo: Rider Preview: The Lich
updates.update_content:
Greetings, backers! 
 In today's update we take a closer look at one of our riders, The Lich. The Lich loves to collect the souls of the fallen, both enemy and ally. So whenever a dragon dies near the Lich, his Soul Capture ability briefly steals away the victim’s soul. And here's where it gets interesting: The Lich can then turn these souls into deadly projectiles using his Tortured Soul ability. And the more souls he's captured, the faster he can fire them off. The Lich has one more deadly weapon in his arsenal, but we'll let you visit our website to find out more about it.

updates.update_userinfo: Character Building Illustrated
updates.update_content:
Greetings, backers! 
Today's update features a special blog post by our incredibly talented art team. Ever wondered how game characters are created? Art Director Tracy Butler and her incredible crew illustrate, step by step, how a character evolves from a rough concept sketch to fully animated, in-game implementation. 
Here are a few images to whet your appetite; visit our website for the full post!

updates.update_userinfo: Siege Mode Explained
updates.update_content:
Greetings, backers! 
As the campaign marches on, we wanted to update you all on some of the game content we've been working on in the office. Today we'll be previewing Siege mode, a new game mode that's all about Titans.

campaign.story:
Vidéo sous-titrée en Français ici 
# NEW VIDEO
All the iSketchnote team wanted to say THANK YOU to all of the people that believe in us. This new video is for you! You’ll see some of the features of our current app, the new stretch goals and the incredible potential of the iSketchnote technology. 
$375,000: And for our last stretch goal, we’ll offer a new Green felt pen with your iSketchnote cover!
# STRETCH GOALS UNLOCKED
$325,000: iSketchnote Blue edition!
$300,000: iSketchnote Pink edition!
$250,000! We just reached our stretch goal!!! iSketchnote for PC and Mac!!!
No iPad, no problem! Now you will be able to connect your iSketchnote cover to your PC/Mac via a simple USB connection!  
$175,000! Our backers are amazing. First iSketchnote stretch goal is now unlocked !! Thank you all and let's spread the word !
Every iSketchnote backer ($119 reward minimum) will be able to choose between the classic iSketchnote cover and the iSketchnote Special Edition Cover at the end of the campaign!
PRESS COVERAGE
THE STORY
We love to doodle, make sketchnotes, and we love the iPad. We also love the feel of a pen travelling on a sheet of paper. But nothing existed that combined the power of the iPad with the comfort of writing on paper. So, we invented iSketchnote! 
None of the existing technologies provide the real experience of a pen and paper. So keep your habits and use the only technology that allows you to digitize your sketches and notes in real time.
No specific paper. No electronic pen. Just iSketchnote!
MIKE ROHDE IS SUPPORTING THE PROJECT!
How can we speak about Sketchnote without mentioning Mike Rohde?
His book fueled our interest in Sketchnote and sparked the idea for iSketchnote as well. If you want to learn more about Sketchnote, try the Sketchnote handbook and back the project!
The Sketchnoters community seems to appreciate iSketchnote on Twitter as well!
Doug Neil, Author of The Graphic Recorder
Sketchnoters and iPad enthusiasts, check this out! http://www.isketchnote.com/ Excited to see more. Well done @iSketchnote!
Rebecca Welch, founding director of no.41 consulting
Best of luck to @isketchnote on their @kickstarter journey with what looks like an incredible #sketchnote tool #iamin #visualcommunication 
VisualNotetaking.net, A curated blog covering the creative world of visual notes, visual recording, graphic facilitation, graphic recording and sketchnotes.  
@iSketchnote please let us know when your kickstarter campaign goes live. We'll post about it :)
A DISRUPTIVE TECHNOLOGY
iSketchnote is a smart iPad cover that integrates a new digitizing technology with the convenience of a notebook: We call it ISKN Technology.
It’s a sensor matrix that recognizes and tracks our pens in real time. We also have eight patents pending and several others are in progress. Here are some of the various electronics prototypes we have experimented with.
1st electronics prototype
2nd electronics prototype
Our latest version
NATURAL PEN DESIGNED FOR ALL PEN AND PAPER LOVERS!
It's not "like a real pen" it is a real pen!
No battery, no electronics! Just a simple permanent magnet ring that is embedded into these classic pens.
For our Kickstarter campaign, we created a contemporary range of designs with a smart and trendy spirit. 
Early sketches
We used premium material with a special ABS soft touch. Today, the range is composed of three pens: one black ballpoint, one orange felt and one black felt.
We are currently establishing partnerships with LARGE pen companies so a full range of pens will be available soon!
Our electronics matrix recognizes the colour and tip of each iSketchnote pen thanks to the magnetic ring. But, we can associate individual pens to any of the colours in the app!
Initially, each pen is recognized for its real colour: you are drawing in orange so the colour will be orange on the app. But, under software control you can change the tip and colour of the pen so, for example, you can make an orange and black Sketchnote in your notebook but it will look blue and yellow on the app!
First real prototypes (ballpoint)
A USER-FRIENDLY FOLDABLE COVER ...
OPEN MODE
You can digitize your sketches and notes in real time!
Make some notes on your iPad and sketchnotes on your notebook at the same time. Watch a video on your iPad, take some notes, stop the video and your notes are already stored on your iPad.
Open Mode enables real-time sharing of your sketchnotes. Imagine you are drawing in your notebook in Paris and a friend of yours in London can see the result in live streaming thanks to the iPad!
MOBILE MODE
Imagine you're at a conference or in class, standing room only, no table, but need to take some notes…You have an idea while you are seated outside and you want to capture it on your knee…
This mode allows you to use the cover in a user-friendly position, directly on your knee or standing, without a screen.
iPADLESS MODE
Your iSketchnote cover works even without the iPad! Simply create all your sketchnotes on your iSketchnote cover and they will be automatically transferred to your iPad the next time you connect to it.
Initially, the iPadless mode only works with an iPad. We will provide a free Windows and Mac OS update to our backers as soon as it becomes available.
While an SD card isn’t provided, with a 4GB one you can store at least 100 pages – actually it’s more than 300 drawing hours. 
...WITH A CHIC FRENCH TOUCH
"I can't live or work without drawing – and I can't live or work without my computer and iPad. When the innovative engineers at iSketchnote asked me to join their team I thought it was my dream job come true! I just couldn't believe iSketchnote was that close to a reality.
With my team of designers, we brought our 25 years of product design experience, our network of top companies, added a touch of French styling, and made it all happen.
Hey designers, we need the iSketchnote! I'll be the first to get them kick-started on Kickstarter!"
More information on Inconito and Petzl.
Christophe's early sketches... 
CO-DESIGN THE iSketchnote APP
Contribute to the app design, add all the features you need … make the app of your dream! How? Back the project and take part in the development process. We will contact all our backers as soon as the Kickstarter campaign is finished.
We have the basics and all the technical features...
We've got a STAR feature called "Instant replay" (showed by Stephen on the Kickstarter video). Unlike your Smartphone photos, you'll be able to share the construction of your sketchnotes and not just the results!
Enhance your work on your iPad, back it up in your Gallery, and share it immediately on your favourite media sites.
First list of features:
Playback/Instant replay
Pen colour modifications – post iSketchnote creation
Pen tip modifications – post iSketchnote creation
Layers
Export formats
…
We have listed a set of possible features, but we are really open to your ideas and this is why we need your help during the co-design session to finish our app!
ISKETCHNOTE FOR DEVELOPERS 
You are a developer or a software business that wants to create or adapt an app for iSketchnote. How can I do that?
We are open for partnerships and we can provide the API (check out the rewards on the right)!
C++ API for Mac OS/Linux/Windows, objective C API for iOS
Sample Code
The API provides magnet position and orientation, recognition data and contact detection data of the pen
The API uses a USB connection for desktop platforms and a BLE interface for iPad and iPhone
APPS WE LOVE
Enrich the iSketchnote experience with your favourite apps. We are planning to contact Evernote, Paper, Penultimate, Vision Objects…You can also follow us on Facebook, Twitter or on our Kickstarter page to suggest new partnerships or create your own application!
CONSUMER vs KICKSTARTER BACKERS
We expect that the suggested retail price for an iSketchnote will be $189 beggining May 2014. For all backers, the price will be $149 but for early birds, it's only $119 - a 37 % discount!
We aren't earning any money with this Kickstarter project, but we will succeed in launching our project with the manufacture of 1,000 iSketchnote covers!
Most importantly, we will give all our backers the opportunity to co-design the iSketchnote app!
TODAY
We have been working very hard for the last two years and have built several prototypes (electronics and app) and have even filed several patents on our technology.
We have already secured our components and are in discussions with several manufacturers. All we need now is your support to make this all a reality.
Our goal: to integrate our iSketchnote electronics into a sleek and sexy iPad cover!
$35,000? NOT MORE?
We are asking you to make a special effort to helps us produce the iSketchnote.
Obviously, we would like to raise more than $35,000 with your help ;). The $35,000 combined with our private money is enough for us to validate the iSketchnote concept and launch the first manufacturing round of 1,000 iSketchnote covers.
In addition to manufacturing the 1,000 iSketchnote covers, we will finish the latest updates to the electronics and upgrade the prototype from a USB connection to wireless.
We are currently working on the Bluetooth version of iSketchnote, but we need the funds from the Kickstarter campaign to finish the job.
Actually, we have already validated our Bluetooth design with a Windows prototype, but since iSketchnote is an iPad cover we still have more work to do.
Currently, we are working on the hardware and embedded software settings of our Bluetooth Low Energy Module to configure it as an external device able to communicate with an iOS device.
At the same time, as our iPad app will manage the wireless connection, we need some iPad software development using the iOS Bluetooth framework to scan, connect and share data with our electronics.
THE PLAN
PRODUCTION TIMELINE
It’s important to understand that we’ll produce iSketchnote in three parts: the electronics, the cover and the pens.
It’s easy and quick for an electronics factory to produce 1,000 devices. So we’ll get the chance to have an interactive process and, if necessary, to easily produce more covers. We are still evaluating our choice for manufacturer and currently have a short list of three companies.
To manufacture the iSketchnote cover, we need to integrate the electronics inside the cover, perform final tests and quality controls. We already chose an international company capable of marketing a wide and varied range of laptop and tablet bags. The factory for our cover is in Guangzhou, China, and has an annual production capacity of 800,000. Our designer, Christophe Chedal Anglay, will follow all the manufacturing process and bring his 25 years of product design experience to this crucial phase.
Concerning the pens, we already have the ballpoint pen prototype (check out the video) so we’ll make our feedback soon and production will be launch as soon as we have completed evaluation of the felt pen prototype.
July 2013:
We showed iSketchnote technology (USB prototype) and iSketchnote pens during the SIGGRAPH show in Anaheim. We enjoyed the visit of Apple, Google, Wacom, Samsung and many visitors who tested the technology and gave us important feedback.
August-September 2013:
Kickstarter, Kickstarter and Kickstarter! We've been working night and day to submit our project and meet Kickstarter’s guidelines and expectations. We also prepared the team to sleep a little bit less during September :) We plan to end our campaign by the end of September. As soon as we have reached our goal, we’ll expedite sourcing and manufacturing.
 October 2013:
Post crowdfunding period. Since we'll have already secured our components, we plan to launch sourcing in late October. The deadline will be early January, when we’ll launch preproduction and testing.
We’ll make our choice for the electronics manufacturer and send all our feedback for pen prototypes. 
1st co-design session for the app. We have the basics and all the technical features (especially our "Instant replay" star feature), but since we want to co-design the app with ours supporters, we'll be organizing regular “co-design sessions” to incorporate your feedback and ideas in through our social media sites until the iSketchnote begins to ship.
November - December 2013:
We’ll begin to "tool up" for manufacturing the electronics and cover.
We’ll integrate all the feedbacks and ideas from the 1st co-design session on our iPad app.
Preproduction and testing for the pens.
January - February 2014:
CES in Las Vegas! As during the last SIGGRAPH, we’ll have a booth to demonstrate the power of our technology and give you the opportunity to try our latest iSketchnote Bluetooth enabled prototype. We’ll also get to meet the ISKETCHNOTE PIONEERS (check the rewards!).
2nd co-design session.
Preproduction and testing for the electronics and cover: by this time, the transition from USB to Bluetooth will be complete.
Production for the pens.
March - April 2014:
Assuming all goes well in the preproduction and testing phases, we’ll launch the production run of (30 days) and the assembly of the iSketchnote.
May 2014:
The first wave of iSketchnote is scheduled to roll out to our Kickstarter backers!
WE WERE AT #SIGGRAPH2013!
To meet potential business and industrial partners, we were present at the latest SIGGRAPH event, July  21- 25, 2013 inAnaheim, CA.
Now in its 40th year, the SIGGRAPH conference is the premier international event on computer graphics and interactive techniques. SIGGRAPH 2013 is expected to draw more than 20,000 professionals from five continents to Anaheim, California. 
Tristan, co-founder of ISKN, was showing iSketchnote features on our stand
We showed iSketchnote technology, iSketchnote pens and also new devices that we are currently developing. We enjoyed visits of Apple, Google, Wacom, Samsung and many others who tested the technology and provided valuable feedback.
ELECTRONICS IS OUR BUSINESS.
USER EXPERIENCE DESIGN IS OUR PASSION.
We have been working very hard for the last two years with a multidisciplinary team of engineers and artists.
The Kickstarter project is directed by Jean-Luc VALLEJO and Timothee JOBERT. They have spent more than 10 years at LETI, a top French research institute in nano and microelectronics, leading R&D projects with international companies and start-ups (ST Microelectronics, SOITEC, IBM, NOKIA, and MOVEA).
In 2013, they founded ISKN, Inc, a company whose mission is to combine the natural experience of familiar tools with the power of technology. Using patented sensor technology (ISKN has eight patents pending and several others are in progress), the company is working to integrate ISKN technology into many new devices.
ISKN TEAM
Timothee Jobert
ISKN Co-founder. Timothee is a User Experience Designer specialized in new technology. He was Head of User Experience Design Group at CEA LETI, working on motion capture with MOVEA and ST ERICSSON. 
Jean-Luc Vallejo
ISKN Co-founder. Before being Business Manager at ISKN, Jean-Luc was Head of Laboratory at the CEA LETI. He was in charge of the MEMS production activity during seven years and he worked to capture the value created by research and development towards market applications and technology transfer.
Tristan Hautson
ISKN Co-founder. Tristan is an Embedded Software engineer and he has developed the technology for the last two years. Tristan is the inventor of the ISKN's eight patents pending.
Stephen Walsh
ISKN Co-founder. Stephen is an adjunct professor of ECE and former Director Engineering Entrepreneurs Program at NC State University, and an Associate Professor of Entrepreneurship at the Grenoble Ecole de Management. As part of his work, he coaches scientists and engineers at the French CEA LETI who are spinning out technologies into new products and companies. He has been involved with the iSketchnote team for several months.
Clement Rosset
Clement graduated from Grenoble Graduate School of Business. He is our Kickstarter project manager, working on business strategy.
Lydie Roure
Lydie is in charge of public relations. She has a background in Marketing and Communication. She is also the best Sketchnoter of the team!
Rabeb Aloui
Rabeb is a Software engineer who joined the team a year and a half ago to work on algorithmic aspects and user interface.
Guilhem Sauvagnac
Guilhem is a Hardware engineer. He designed the electronics for all the prototypes. He also works on algorithms integration on the microcontroller. 
Colin Aygalinc & Prince Arnaud Ramahefa-Andry
Recently graduated from engineer school, Colin and Arnaud are currently interns working on Bluetooth connectivity and battery integration.
THE REWARDS
HALL OF FAME - Pledge $1 or more
Every iSketchnote backer is welcome! Thank you very much for believing in this project. You will receive backer-only updates, have the opportunity to co-design the app with our community, and have your name put on our giant backer’s Sketchnote that will be broadcast on our website and on other social media.
iSKETCHNOTE PEN - Pledge $29 or more
Get the first set of iSketchnote pens! We created a contemporary set of THREE design pens with a smart, chic, and trendy look. Use it with your future iSketchnote cover or on your favorite notebook. One black ballpoint (lead 0.02 inches/0.5 mm, height 5.98 inches/152 mm, diameter 0.41 inches/10.5 mm); one orange felt (lead 0.04 inches/1 mm, height 5.51 inches/140 mm, diameter 0.47 inches/12 mm); one black felt (lead 0.04 inches/1 mm, height 5.51 inches/140 mm, diameter 0.47 inches/12 mm) PLUS Backer-only updates PLUS co-design the app PLUS giant backer’s Sketchnote
iSKETCHNOTE EARLY BIRDS - Pledge $119 or more
The first 200 backers get a complete iSketchnote pack for the crazy early bird Kickstarter price of just $119!!! That means you are saving $70 off the expected retail price for one iSketchnote Cover PLUS three iSketchnote pens! We can only offer a limited number at this price, so get ready to share your iSketchnotes with your friends! PLUS Backer-only updates PLUS co-design the app PLUS giant backer’s Sketchnote
iSKETCHNOTE - Pledge $149 or more
Weren’t able to get an early bird reward? Not a problem! You can still get a complete iSketchnote pack for the crazy Kickstarter price of just $149!!! It means that you are saving $40 off the expected retail price for one iSketchnote Cover PLUS three iSketchnote pens! We can only offer a limited number at this price, so get ready to share your iSketchnotes with your friends! PLUS Backer only updates PLUS co-designs the app PLUS giant backer’s Sketchnote
iSKETCHNOTE FOR IPAD MINI- Pledge $149 or more
iSketchnote cover for iPad mini! Especially for our supporters who expressly ask for it! PLUS three iSketchnote pens PLUS Backer-only updates PLUS co-design the app PLUS giant backer’s Sketchnote
iSKETCHNOTE DEVELOPERS - Pledge $199 or more 
Especially for developers who want to build their own app! We'll provide a complete iSketchnote pack plus an EARLY API ACCESS and technical support from our team to help you to get started!PLUS Backer-only updates PLUS co-design the app PLUS giant backer’s Sketchnote.
iSKETCHNOTE PIONEERS - Pledge $499 or more
Every backer will have the opportunity to be part of the app development community. But being an iSketchnote pioneer means that you will have the opportunity to be part of ALL of the development process! You get privileged access to Timothee and all the rest of the team. In addition, if you can make it to the next CES 2014 in Las Vegas, you will get the chance to test the iSketchnote beta version and have a French-style dinner with the team while you’re there! PLUS $149 rewards PLUS Backer only updates PLUS co-designs the app PLUS giant backer’s Sketchnote
MIDNIGHT IN PARIS - Pledge $4,999 or more
Welcome to Paris, France!!! For a pledge of $4,999, we invite you to be our guest for a fantastic visit to Paris. We will contact you to arrange your visit, and we'll deal with the tickets, hotel, and restaurants for a special weekend…plus a special French-style guide. ;) Enjoy the Moulin Rouge, tour the Eiffel Tower and Sacré Coeur, have some baguettes, chocolates, and more… You will also receive a personalized iSketchnote pack from the founders – including the app with some unique features – and have a private meeting with the team to learn more about our technology and the story behind the iSketchnote.
SPECIAL THANKS
BDI Team, Stephen & Maureen, Majda, Elisabeth, Valerie, Etienne, CEA LETI, IRT NanoElec, Grenoble Ecole de Management (GEM), GRAIN, Mike Rohde and everyone who helped us during the project creation! 
TRADEMARKS
APPLE and iPad are trademarks of Apple, registered in the US and other countries.
MOLESKINE is a trademark of Moleskine, registered in the US and other countries.
PENULTIMATE and EVERNOTE are trademarks of Evernote, registered in the US and other countries.
Paper 53 is a trademark of FiftyThree, registered in the US and other countries.
SKETCHNOTE is a trademark of Mike Rohde, registered in the US and other countries.
MyScript Notes Mobile is a trademark of Vision Objects, registered in France and other countries.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Project Timelines
Unlike many projects, we have already secured the iSketchnote components and have lined up a manufacturing partner. We are working with a French company that has significant experience in mass production both here and abroad. Product feasibility is not a problem, but holding multiple suppliers to our schedule could pose a risk. We’ll do everything in our power to deliver the iSketchnote pen and cover on time, but we are dealing with multiple suppliers, which could pose a schedule risk.

Financial Forecast
Will $35,000 really be enough to meet our goal? We think so. As we said, the $35,000 combined with our private money is enough for us to validate the iSketchnote concept and launch the first manufacturing round of 1,000 iSketchnote covers. Our operating margin for this round of manufacturing is small. Unexpected problems could cut into that margin, but we are prepared for it.

Electronic Development
Electronics is our business, but design is our passion. iSketchnote will need some additional development as we bridge the gap between our USB prototype and our Bluetooth prototype. In addition, we are also working to improve the user interface and stability of the iSketchnote calibration technology.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: The Slate 2 is here!
updates.update_content:
Hello backers!
How are you? We hope you had a wonderful summer! If you have seen our latest news, you know we have been really busy working on the brand new Slate over the summer. We launched the product for preorders last Thursday and couldn’t be more excited! Thanks to you, the adventure continues...

campaign.story:
Self Publisher Magazine started in 1989, and has continued to exist in some form or another as we have watched how publications are made, how they are distributed, and verily, how and where they are read. Over a year ago, SP! Adopted a Free-for-all PDF format, giving itself away to help small press publishers have a place they can get coverage in a market that relies more and more on either corporate controlled e-distribution or social media...which can be terribly fragmented from person to person.
We have, however, continued to receive requests for printed copies of the magazine, and would like to add that option back into our mix. We have decided to adopt a POD/Subscription model that will be linked to the new Self Publisher Association printing service. The service will also be part of the Cloud 9 App, making digital comics, available in print, directly from your Kindles and Ipads, anywhere. To accomplish what we want, we need to invest in some new software options, and we feel the best way to raise these funds is by getting an issue into print, to show everyone what we will be doing from then on every month.
Issue #70 of Self Publisher! Magazine will be a feature spotlight on the newly re-designed and re-launched Cloud 9 App, so we think that will be a great issue to put into the new print option for launch. YOU can help make this all happen, by supporting this project. As an added benefit from our doing this, we plan to drop plans to start charging for SP! Magazine PDFs, and keep them freely available in digital form, for the entire year 2014 at least.
You can check out our latest digital issue right now! #67 is just-out, and is a great representation of our magazine. We are hard at work on #68 layouts right now, for mid-September release. That issue will have a cover feature on Miguel Guerra's Earth Dream anthology project, a bi-lingual Earth Day event. #69 will feature Drunken Cat Comics. We will post those new issues here in the Kickstarter as they are released! SP! is an all-volunteer staff, and run by the people, for the people.
Click to get a copy of #67:
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Upon success of this project, the biggest challenge will become continuing to reach new readers, because that is what most promotional things are missing these days. They rely on a book's publisher to bring their readers to their system, and then boast how many people are buying something, but, they are not a source of NEW readership. Publishers need exposure to new readers, and that is what has become so cloudy in today's market. I think we have proven that the SP! Team we have can put out new issues every month, as we have for over a year, and it is our goal to maintain that. We will really need some new staff to hit the next level, and finding the right people will be hard, but, worth it.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Smiley's GN comments?
updates.update_content:
For everyone keeping up with the SP! roller coaster...the new issue is out! That puts us one step closer to the #70 issue launching of printed editions that this kickstarter got us the funds to accomplish. So go enjoy the latest issue, and I'll be setting up the subscription set up soon! Everyone due a copy of SP! #70 can look forward to seeing it in December! Other goodies should all be in your hands by now.
Self Publisher! Magazine #69 has been released! Go grab yourself a FREE copy at: http://www.selfpubmag.com/downloads/entry/free-downloads/self-publisher/self-publisher_15.htm This issue: Cover feature on Drunken Cat Comics' Brian Canini and Derek Baxter, Interviews with Tristan Roulot, Gibson Quarter and Luke Donkersloot, James Lyle, Shane Chebsey and Pete Rogers. Articles on the Toronto Fan Expo and UCreateComics, Sneak Peek features on Revelations and Drago Bentley (a Cloud 9 Exclusive). By Ian Shires, Ellen Fleischer, Louise Cochran-Mason, Mark Turner, and Liam Webb. Layouts by Jay Savage. 40 Pages of Awesome, in a link-enhanced PDF magazine, TELL YOUR FRIENDS IT'S FREE!!

updates.update_userinfo: New Issue!!
updates.update_content:
thank you to everyone who backed this project. We have accomplished something significant: The launching of a new print service, and, SP! will remain FREE in e-format through all of 2014. As soon as the $$ is confirmed in, I will begin getting the incentive prizes out to everyone. 
From the bottom of my heart, thank you. I will continue to dedicate my time and effort into getting people to read about other self publishers, get to know them, their work, and do everything I can to boost our niche of the publishing industry.

updates.update_userinfo: Rewards!
updates.update_content:
So today, I woke up and someone cancelled their pledge. Since we're like only JUST over the "success" amount, that really scares me. With about a week left till this closes, I would hate to see our support, evaporate. It seems to me, celebrating that we "Made it" was probably the worst thing we could do...because we haven't gotten any additional support since. 
Folks, the $300 goal was a minimum that we needed to accomplish getting set up. There is a huge amount more that we COULD do if we brought in more. The Self Publisher Association would love to bring Small Press Idol back, the Self Publisher Hall of Fame is just a dream until we can really put organizational things in place, and that all takes $$.

updates.update_userinfo: We did it!!
updates.update_content: Woke up today to find that we're fully funded...which means that Self Publisher! Magazine will be able to launch the printed editions AND remain as a FREE PDF for all of 2014. That's GREAT, folks. But let's not stop there! Keep spreading the word, and let's see if we can raise additional funds to get some of the other Self Publisher Association plans off the back burner and into development. We'd love to get Small Press Idol started up, the Hall of Fame off the ground, and our Schoolastic program into action...all of those things can become reality with YOUR support. Keep spreading the word! And THANK YOU to everyone who has pledged already, and made sure SP! will be there for everyone. I promise to be here, working my butt off, to get us to the next level, all the time. You have all restored my faith in what we're trying to accomplish!

updates.update_userinfo: A little Scarey
updates.update_content: It's really great the support that is turning out for our mission here. I wanted to make sure everyone knows, assuming we hit the goal, if we go OVER the goal, I am thinking about printing extra copies of the issue, to send to someone who is doing a comic show. Don't have a target person or show yet, but that is what extra $$ will be used for. Thank you very very much for helping with the mission, and I will continue to do EVERYTHING I can to increase the readership of SP! and in doing so, increase the potential readership of ALL SMALL PRESS.

updates.update_userinfo: Keep going!
updates.update_content: Hi everyone! I wanted to thank the supporters who have turned out so far and gotten us almost HALFWAY to the goal! This really warms my heart and gears me up to really reach this goal, and keep SP! going for free every month. Please, if you can, tell friends about this mission, help spread the word. Let them know even if they just come and look this over, they can get a free copy of the latest issue by clicking the cover.

updates.update_userinfo: 3 Days in...68% there!
updates.update_content: I wanted to make sure it was perfectly clear, as someone asked me this. Is this the only way to order a copy of the magazine issue? No. It wont be. There will be a retail price for the single-copy sale of the magazine, later. Remember, we are looking at the November issue here...and the kickstarter is about launching a new POD system for us, which will be opened up for other publishers once fully operational. Supporting this project helps us to be in a stronger position to make sure Self Publisher! Magazine remains freely available as a PDF online and people who have been asking for printed copies, will be able to get them.

project_data.project_name: Keep Self Publisher! Magazine Free

campaign.story:
Actor Sean Bridgers talks about directing my music video
MANY REWARDS ARE STILL AVAILABLE Please Visit http://www.BradCarter.me for details!

PLEASE STAY IN TOUCH WITH ME AT http://www.Facebook.com/BradCarterFanPage
http://www.twitter.com/DisIzBradCarter
My name is Brad Carter.  I am an actor, artist, occasional stand-up comedian, and a guitarist from Macon, Georgia now living in Los Angeles, Ca.  In the past few months I've had two surgeries on my brain to help me play guitar again. Maybe you saw it on the "Today Show" or your local news. I never knew any of that was going to happen. All I wanted was to be able to play guitar for a few years longer.  I have a disease called "Essential Tremor". This is a progressive neurological disease and there is no cure. My doctors think it could very well become Parkinson's in the near future. I want to make the most of the time the surgery has given me by recording an album and sharing my story with you. Thank you for becoming a part of this Kickstarter project. It means the world to me.
Scroll down to learn more about my project, see who will be part of the album, and take a look at some incredible pics from my surgery. 

Surprise guests announced every few days via Video Messages offering SPECIAL PERKS! Guests so far include: Tony Hawk, Lance Krall (Free Radio, The Lance Krall Show), and Gerry Bednob (40 year old Virgin, Zak and Miri Make A Porno)
I want to do what seemed so impossible and out of reach only a few months ago: RECORD A FULL LENGTH PROFESSIONAL ALBUM!  I have been given this awesome and unexpected opportunity to tell my story and share it with the world. I want to record an album and tell you my story through my music.
Some of my favorite artists and friends have agreed to pitch in on the album. I'm very excited to have:

SEAN WATKINS 
(Nickel Creek, Fiction Family, Watkins Family Hour) 
TOM BROSSEAU
  JESSE THOMAS
Mary Elizabeth Winstead will provide backup vocals on a couple of tracks.
SO WHERE DOES YOUR MONEY GO? I have spoken with an amazing producer and friend of mine Jim Roach. Jim broke it down for me to a minimum of $45,000.00 This includes prep, recording, studio time, producer time, studio musicians, guest musicians, mixing, mastering, packaging, and artwork to support the album. 
Here is how the $45,000 breaks down:
Producer fee - $2500 x 10 Songs = $25,000
Studio Time- $300 per day x 20 days = $6,000
Mixing - $500 per song = $5,000
Mastering= $1,200
CD Production= $1,100
Recording Total = Approximately $38,500

Then we add in:  Kickstarter Fees (5%)
Amazon Fees (5%)
and team support, editor of my KS vids, PR and Publicist expenses, shipping of the rewards, and TAX. Yes that's right I get taxed on this.
We're looking at a minimum Goal = $45,000
For 7 years I have struggled with losing control of my hands to a disease called "Essential Tremor", making it more and more difficult to play and perform. Having played music for many years, losing the ability to do the thing I love the most has been quite difficult and heartbreaking. I have run the gamut of emotions with this and sometimes the depression has been overwhelming. I've done my best to adapt to my tremor in order to keep working as an actor. 
On May 23rd of this year I was given a chance to fight back and prolong my skills through a medical procedure called "DBS" (Deep Brain Stimulation). This is a procedure that involves the placing of electrodes in my brain and a control in my chest. By using electrical stimulation to a tiny spot in my thalamus, my doctors hope to improve my condition and to be able to manage it. The surgery took about 7 hours and I was awake for 6 hours of it, and YES it was SCARY as HELL! 
Prepping for the "Halo"
Not fun
You have to be awake so that you can respond to your doctors and find just the right spot to place the electrode. It is incredibly complicated. The thalamus also controls speech and there were times when I completely lost my ability to speak. It is the most surreal thing I have ever experienced in my life. 
The worst thing I ever felt in my life. Let's just say I picked the wrong day to stop cussing.
Holding my hand through some painful moments.
Because I was the 500th patient at UCLA to have this procedure done, the hospital asked to film the surgery, and honestly I thought it would be really cool to have it. I mean how often do you get a video of your own brain surgery? 
I played my guitar during the surgery and it was tweeted live and suddenly it became world news! It was viewed over 30 million times on just the first day. Before long it was on every news channel in the world. Hong Kong, Australia, Iran, you name it. Weird. 
Live on Twitter and Vine.
My one-of-a-kind handmade Kurt Schoen Guitar. Made from a 1930's shotgun shell crate.
Drawing Spirals to track the tremor intensity.
Working to find the best possible placement of the electrode by displaying my tremor.
Dr. Bordelon.
You can see the massive difference in spirals. Pretty cool right?
After 7 hours, Dr. Pouratian assuring me we had done well.
I even had the opportunity to share my story on The Today Show. 
Here's the Today Show clip.
UCLA PRESS CONFERENCE AND UPDATE ON MY RECOVERY
Stretch Goal #1: $55,000 MUSIC VIDEO
Of course I hope to overshoot our goal and be able to afford to do more, including a MUSIC VIDEO (because you can't have an album without a music video).We need a minimum of $10,000 for our Music Video. I have an amazing concept for my first single called "Drunk Again" and have some AMAZING guest cameo's in the works.

My good friend Sean Bridgers (Deadwood) has agreed to direct the video! Check out some more of Sean's work! http://www.travelinproductions.com/

On top of that we will have Special Guest Appearances

by Dayton Callie (Deadwood/Sons of Anarchy) 
Earl W. Brown (Deadwood, Something About Mary)
Leah Cevoli (Deadwood/Robot Chicken) 

Leah will also be a Co-Producer on the Music Video.

We have many other surprise guests we're in talks with and will announce them throughout the campaign!
Over to the right-hand side of your screen we have a really cool list of rewards. Digital downloads, signed CDs, T-shirts, a signed guitar, a signed banjo, producer credit, private concerts, studio tours, and lots more. And to top it off, we have some secret celebrity guests offering unique rewards throughout the campaign. So be sure to check back 
often.
My lucky "Chick Magnet" audition Trucker Style Hat. I've worn this to pretty much every audition I ever booked. The wardrobe stylist dirtied it up real nice with fake dirt. I wore this hat on 2 episodes of "Justified" as the character "Bobby Joe Packer.
Eric Clapton "Blackie" Stratocaster to be signed by everyone on the album.
Deering Goodtime Banjo to be signed by everyone on the album..
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I originally launched my Kickstarter in July. I had no idea how much work Kickstarter was and I foolishly was attempting to run this campaign on my own. After just a few days, I was overwhelmed with follow-up Doctor visits as they continue to dial in the device to control my tremors, and realized it was best to pause my campaign, bring a team together to help me and relaunch in a few weeks.

 I will be giving constant updates on the progress and keeping you in the loop. You can also "like" me at www.facebook.com/bradcarterfanpage for constant updates and follow me @DisIzBradCarter 
Thank You.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Hey guys and gals, here’s some updates!
updates.update_content:
Hello Kickstarter backers. Thank you again for your ongoing patience! I want to assure you that I am trying my very best to create an album that is worthy of everyones donation. I realize it has been a long long time now, but again I want to stress how difficult it has been to figure out this elusive industry and afford to try and clean up mistakes made by myself and the original producer of the initial recordings. I admit that if I knew how hard that would be I would have started from scratch a long time ago. Here's what's been happening: 
 As I can afford it I have traveled to Asheville NC three times within the last 4 months to try and wrap this up and get this ready to be remixed, remastered and in the can. It has cost thousands more than I ever dreamt and at this point I cannot and will not accept anything other than greatness both on behalf of you all and myself. It turns out there's a steep price to pay for being unaccepting of mediocrity and to figure out where the right combo of relationships and affordable skills lay. To be frank I am at the mercy of my finances and of certain peoples availability to lend an affordable hand.

Happy New Year to everyone and thank you so much for your patience! I have not forgotten you :)

updates.update_content: Hello everyone! Just a little note to say I have not forgotten anyone! This has been an incredibly long and expensive lesson in record making. I am traveling to Asheville, NC soon to correct something on the record and then it's off to the races! Thank you for your incredible patience and words of encouragement. I had to cancel my EP release show last month when I broke my arm. It is still healing up, so when it's better I will let you know more about that show. For those of you who got cd's,  I will be sending you signed copies of both the album and EP.
